3845 statements  

1#!/usr/bin/env python 

2# -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 

3""" 

4:mod:`cape.attdb.rdb`: Template ATTDB database 

5======================================================== 

6 

7This module provides the class :class:`DataKit` as a subclass of 

8:class:`dict` that contains methods common to each of the other database 

9classes. The :class:`DataKit` class provides an interface to both store 

10the data and create and call "response surfaces" that define specific, 

11potentially complex interpolation methods to evaluate the data as a 

12function of several independent variables. 

13 

14Finally, having this common template class provides a single point of 

15entry for testing if an object is based on a product of the 

16:mod:`cape.attdb.rdb` module. The following Python sample tests if 

17any Python object *db* is an instance of any class from this data-file 

18collection. 

19 

20 .. code-block:: python 

21 

22 isinstance(db, cape.attdb.rdb.DataKit) 

23 

24This class is the basic data container for ATTDB databases and has 

25interfaces to several different file types. 

26 

27""" 

28 

29# Standard library modules 

30import copy 

31import os 

32import re 

33import sys 

34 

35# Third-party modules 

36import numpy as np 

37 

38# Semi-optional third-party modules 

39try: 

40 import scipy.interpolate as sciint 

41 import scipy.interpolate.rbf as scirbf 

42except ImportError: 

43 sciint = None 

44 scirbf = None 

45 

46# Local modules 

47from . import ftypes 

48from ..tnakit import kwutils as kwutils 

49from ..tnakit import plot_mpl as pmpl 

50from ..tnakit import statutils 

51from ..tnakit import typeutils 

52 

53 

54# Accepted list for response_method 

55RESPONSE_METHODS = [ 

56 None, 

57 "nearest", 

58 "linear", 

59 "linear-schedule", 

60 "rbf", 

61 "rbf-map", 

62 "rbf-linear", 

63] 

64# List of RBF types 

65RBF_METHODS = [ 

66 "rbf", 

67 "rbf-map", 

68 "rbf-linear" 

69] 

70# RBF function types 

71RBF_FUNCS = [ 

72 "multiquadric", 

73 "inverse_multiquadric", 

74 "gaussian", 

75 "linear", 

76 "cubic", 

77 "quintic", 

78 "thin_plate" 

79] 

80# Names of parameters needed to describe an RBF network 

81RBF_SUFFIXES = ["method", "rbf", "func", "eps", "smooth", "N", "xcols"]

84# Options for RDBNull 

85class DataKitOpts(ftypes.BaseFileOpts): 

86 # --- Global Options --- 

87 # List of options 

88 _optlist = { 

89 "csv", 

90 "db" 

91 "mat", 

92 "simplecsv", 

93 "simpletsv", 

94 "textdata", 

95 "xls" 

96 } 

97 

98 # Alternate names 

99 _optmap = { 

100 "tsvsimple": "simpletsv", 

101 "csvsimple": "simplecsv", 

102 "xlsx": "xlsx", 

103 } 

104 

105 

106# Definitions for RDBNull 

107class DataKitDefn(ftypes.BaseFileDefn): 

108 # --- Global Options --- 

109 # Option list 

110 _optlist = { 

111 "Dimension", 

112 "Shape", 

113 } 

114 

115 # Alternate names 

116 _optmap = { 

117 "dim": "Dimension", 

118 "ndim": "Dimension", 

119 "shape": "Shape", 

120 } 

121 

122 # --- Types --- 

123 # Allowed types 

124 _opttypes = { 

125 "Dimension": int, 

126 "Shape": tuple, 

127 } 

128 

129 

130# Combine options with parent class 

131DataKitDefn.combine_optdefs() 

132 

133 

134# Combine options with parent class 

135DataKitOpts.combine_optdefs()

137 

138# Declare base class 

139class DataKit(ftypes.BaseData): 

140 r"""Basic database template without responses 

141 

142 :Call: 

143 >>> db = DataKit(fname=None, **kw) 

144 >>> db = DataKit(db) 

145 :Inputs: 

146 *fname*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

147 File name; extension is used to guess data format 

148 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

149 DataKit from which to link data and defns 

150 *csv*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

151 Explicit file name for :class:`CSVFile` read 

152 *textdata*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

153 Explicit file name for :class:`TextDataFile` 

154 *simplecsv*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

155 Explicit file name for :class:`CSVSimple` 

156 *simpletsv*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

157 Explicit file name for :class:`TSVSimple` 

158 *xls*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

159 File name for :class:`XLSFile` 

160 *mat*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

161 File name for :class:`MATFile` 

162 :Outputs: 

163 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

164 Generic database 

165 :Versions: 

166 * 2019-12-04 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

167 * 2020-02-19 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.1; was ``DBResponseNull`` 

168 """ 

169 # ===================== 

170 # Class Attributes 

171 # ===================== 

172 # < 

173 # --- Options --- 

174 # Class for options 

175 _optscls = DataKitOpts 

176 # Class for definitions 

177 _defncls = DataKitDefn 

178 

179 # --- Special Columns --- 

180 _tagsubmap = {} 

181 

182 # --- Response Method Names --- 

183 # Primary names 

184 _method_names = [ 

185 "exact", 

186 "function", 

187 "multilinear", 

188 "multilinear-schedule", 

189 "nearest", 

190 "rbf", 

191 "rbf-linear", 

192 "rbf-map" 

193 ] 

194 

195 # Alternates 

196 _method_map = { 

197 "fn": "function", 

198 "func": "function", 

199 "lin-rbf": "rbf-linear", 

200 "linear": "multilinear", 

201 "linear-rbf": "rbf-linear", 

202 "linear-schedule": "multilinear-schedule", 

203 "map-rbf": "rbf-map", 

204 "rbf-global": "rbf", 

205 "rbf-schedule": "rbf-map", 

206 "rbf0": "rbf", 

207 "rbf1": "rbf-map", 

208 } 

209 

210 # Method functions 

211 _method_funcs = { 

212 0: { 

213 "exact": "rcall_exact", 

214 "function": "rcall_function", 

215 "multilinear": "rcall_multilinear", 

216 "multilinear-schedule": "rcall_multilinear_schedule", 

217 "nearest": "rcall_nearest", 

218 "rbf": "rcall_rbf", 

219 "rbf-linear": "rcall_rbf_linear", 

220 "rbf-map": "rcall_rbf_schedule", 

221 }, 

222 1: { 

223 "exact": "rcall_exact", 

224 "function": "rcall_function", 

225 "multilinear": "rcall_multilinear", 

226 "multilinear-schedule": "rcall_multilinear_schedule", 

227 "nearest": "rcall_nearest", 

228 }, 

229 } 

230 

231 # Method constructors 

232 _method_constructors = { 

233 "function": "_create_function", 

234 "rbf": "_create_rbf", 

235 "rbf-linear": "_create_rbf_linear", 

236 "rbf-map": "_create_rbf_map", 

237 } 

238 # > 

239 

240 # ============= 

241 # Config 

242 # ============= 

243 # < 

244 # --- Dunder Methods --- 

245 # Initialization method 

246 def __init__(self, fname=None, **kw): 

247 r"""Initialization method 

248 

249 :Versions: 

250 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

251 """ 

252 # Required attributes 

253 self.cols = [] 

254 self.n = 0 

255 self.defns = {} 

256 self.bkpts = {} 

257 self.sources = {} 

258 # Evaluation attributes 

259 self.response_arg_alternates = {} 

260 self.response_arg_converters = {} 

261 self.response_arg_aliases = {} 

262 self.response_arg_defaults = {} 

263 self.response_args = {} 

264 self.response_kwargs = {} 

265 self.response_methods = {} 

266 self.response_xargs = {} 

267 # Radial basis function containers 

268 self.rbf = {} 

269 # Extra attributes for plotting 

270 self.col_pngs = {} 

271 self.col_seams = {} 

272 # 1D output image and seam directives 

273 self.png_fnames = {} 

274 self.png_figs = {} 

275 self.png_kwargs = {} 

276 self.seam_cols = {} 

277 self.seam_figs = {} 

278 self.seam_kwargs = {} 

279 

280 # Process keyword options 

281 self.opts = self.process_kw(_warnmode=0, **kw) 

282 # Create a mapped copy for below 

283 kw = kwutils.map_kw(self._optscls._optmap, **kw) 

284 

285 # Check for null inputs 

286 if (fname is None) and (not kw): 

287 return 

288 

289 # Check for *db* option 

290 db = kw.get("db", fname) 

291 

292 # Get file name extension 

293 if typeutils.isstr(fname): 

294 # Get extension 

295 ext = fname.split(".")[-1] 

296 elif isinstance(db, DataKit): 

297 # Link data from another datakit 

298 self.link_db(db) 

299 # Stop 

300 return 

301 elif fname is not None: 

302 # Too confusing 

303 raise TypeError("Non-keyword input must be ``None`` or a string") 

304 else: 

305 # No file extension 

306 ext = None 

307 

308 # Initialize file name handles for each type 

309 fcsv = None 

310 ftsv = None 

311 fcsvs = None 

312 ftsvs = None 

313 ftdat = None 

314 fxls = None 

315 fmat = None 

316 # Filter *ext* 

317 if ext == "csv": 

318 # Guess it's a mid-level CSV file 

319 fcsv = fname 

320 elif ext == "tsv": 

321 # Guess it's a mid-level TSV file 

322 ftsv = fname 

323 elif ext == "xls": 

324 # Guess it's a spreadsheet 

325 fxls = fname 

326 elif ext == "xlsx": 

327 # Guess it's a spreadsheet 

328 fxls = fname 

329 elif ext == "mat": 

330 # Guess it's a MATLAB file 

331 fmat = fname 

332 elif ext is not None: 

333 # Unable to guess 

334 raise ValueError( 

335 "Unable to guess file type of file name '%s'" % fname) 

336 # Last-check file names 

337 fcsv = kw.pop("csv", fcsv) 

338 ftsv = kw.pop("tsv", ftsv) 

339 fxls = kw.pop("xls", fxls) 

340 fmat = kw.pop("mat", fmat) 

341 fcsvs = kw.pop("simplecsv", fcsvs) 

342 ftsvs = kw.pop("simpletsv", ftsvs) 

343 ftdat = kw.pop("textdata", ftdat) 

344 

345 # Read 

346 if fcsv is not None: 

347 # Read CSV file 

348 self.read_csv(fcsv, **kw) 

349 elif ftsv is not None: 

350 # Read TSV file 

351 self.read_tsv(ftsv, **kw) 

352 elif fxls is not None: 

353 # Read XLS file 

354 self.read_xls(fxls, **kw) 

355 elif fcsvs is not None: 

356 # Read simple CSV file 

357 self.read_csvsimple(fcsvs, **kw) 

358 elif ftsvs is not None: 

359 # Read simple TSV file 

360 self.read_tsvsimple(ftsvs, **kw) 

361 elif ftdat is not None: 

362 # Read generic textual data file 

363 self.read_textdata(ftdat, **kw) 

364 elif fmat is not None: 

365 # Read MATLAB file 

366 self.read_mat(fmat, **kw) 

367 else: 

368 # If reaching this point, process values 

369 self.process_kw_values() 

370 

371 # --- Copy --- 

372 # Copy 

373 def copy(self): 

374 r"""Make a copy of a database class 

375 

376 Each database class may need its own version of this class 

377 

378 :Call: 

379 >>> dbcopy = db.copy() 

380 :Inputs: 

381 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

382 Generic database 

383 :Outputs: 

384 *dbcopy*: :class:`DataKit` 

385 Copy of generic database 

386 :Versions: 

387 * 2019-12-04 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

388 """ 

389 # Form a new database 

390 dbcopy = self.__class__() 

391 # Copy relevant parts 

392 self.copy_DataKit(dbcopy) 

393 # Output 

394 return dbcopy 

395 

396 # Link data from another DataKit 

397 def link_db(self, dbsrc, init=True): 

398 r"""Link attributes from another DataKit 

399 

400 :Call: 

401 >>> qdb = db.link_db(dbsrc, init=True) 

402 :Inputs: 

403 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

404 Generic database 

405 *dbsrc*: :class:`DataKit` 

406 Source database from which to link data 

407 *init*: {``True``} | ``False`` 

408 Flag if this is used to create initial DataKit 

409 :Outputs: 

410 *qdb*: ``True`` | ``False`` 

411 Whether or not *dbsrc* was linked 

412 :Versions: 

413 * 2021-07-20 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

414 """ 

415 # Check *dbsrc* type 

416 if not isinstance(dbsrc, DataKit): 

417 # Copy/link unsuccessful 

418 return False 

419 # Initialize empty DataKit 

420 if init: 

421 DataKit.__init__(self) 

422 # Loop through cols 

423 for col in dbsrc.cols: 

424 # Copy definition first 

425 self.set_defn(col, dbsrc.get_defn(col)) 

426 # Save values 

427 self.save_col(col, dbsrc.get_values(col)) 

428 # Copy/link successful 

429 return True 

430 

431 # Copy attributes and data known to DataKit class 

432 def copy_DataKit(self, dbcopy): 

433 r"""Copy attributes and data relevant to null-response DB 

434 

435 :Call: 

436 >>> db.copy_DataKit(dbcopy) 

437 :Inputs: 

438 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

439 Generic database 

440 *dbcopy*: :class:`DataKit` 

441 Copy of generic database 

442 :Versions: 

443 * 2019-12-04 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

444 """ 

445 # Loop through columns 

446 for col in self.cols: 

447 dbcopy[col] = copy.copy(self[col]) 

448 # Copy all attributes 

449 self.copy__dict__(dbcopy, skip=[]) 

450 

451 # Copy any remaining items 

452 def copy__dict__(self, dbtarg, skip=[]): 

453 r"""Copy all attributes except for specified list 

454 

455 :Call: 

456 >>> db.copy__dict__(dbtarg, skip=[]) 

457 :Inputs: 

458 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

459 Generic database 

460 *dbtarg*: :class:`DataKit` 

461 Generic database; target copy 

462 *skip*: :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

463 List of attributes not to copy 

464 :Effects: 

465 ``getattr(dbtarg, k)``: ``getattr(db, k, vdef)`` 

466 Shallow copy of attribute from *DBc* or *vdef* if necessary 

467 :Versions: 

468 * 2019-12-04 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

469 """ 

470 # Check *skip* 

471 if not isinstance(skip, (list, tuple)): 

472 raise TypeError("Attributes to skip during copy must be list") 

473 # Loop through dict 

474 for k in self.__dict__: 

475 # Check if it should be skipped 

476 if k in skip: 

477 continue 

478 # Get copy, if possible 

479 try: 

480 # Create the copy 

481 vcopy = self.copyitem(self.__dict__[k]) 

482 # Set it 

483 dbtarg.__dict__[k] = vcopy 

484 except Exception: 

485 # No copy 

486 continue 

487 

488 # Copy an attribute if present 

489 def copyattr(self, dbtarg, k, vdef={}): 

490 r"""Make an appropriate copy of an attribute if present 

491 

492 :Call: 

493 >>> db.copyattr(dbtarg, k, vdef={}) 

494 :Inputs: 

495 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

496 Generic database 

497 *dbtarg*: :class:`DataKit` 

498 Generic database; target copy 

499 *k*: :class:`str` 

500 Name of attribute to copy 

501 *vdef*: {``{}``} | :class:`any` 

502 Default value for output attribute if ``getattr(db,k)`` 

503 does not exist 

504 :Effects: 

505 ``getattr(dbtarg, k)``: ``getattr(db, k, vdef)`` 

506 Shallow copy of attribute from *DBc* or *vdef* if necessary 

507 :Versions: 

508 * 2018-06-08 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

509 * 2019-12-04 ``@ddalle``: Copied from :class:`DBCoeff` 

510 """ 

511 # Check for attribute 

512 if hasattr(self, k): 

513 # Get attribute 

514 v = getattr(self, k) 

515 else: 

516 # Use default 

517 v = vdef 

518 # Copy item 

519 vcopy = self.copyitem(v) 

520 # Save it 

521 setattr(dbtarg, k, vcopy) 

522 

523 # Copy an item according to local rules 

524 def copyitem(self, v): 

525 r"""Return a copy of appropriate depth following class rules 

526 

527 :Call: 

528 >>> vcopy = db.copyitem(v) 

529 :Inputs: 

530 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

531 Generic database 

532 *v*: :class:`any` 

533 Variable to be copied 

534 :Outputs: 

535 *vcopy*: *v.__class__* 

536 Copy of *v* (shallow or deep) 

537 :Versions: 

538 * 2019-12-04 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

539 """ 

540 # Type 

541 t = v.__class__ 

542 # Check the type in order to make a copy 

543 if v is None: 

544 # Not necessary to copy 

545 return 

546 elif t == dict: 

547 # Deep copy of dictionary 

548 try: 

549 return copy.deepcopy(v) 

550 except Exception: 

551 return dict(v) 

552 elif hasattr(v, "copy"): 

553 # Use class's already-build copy() method 

554 return v.copy() 

555 elif t == list: 

556 # Copy list 

557 return list(v) 

558 else: 

559 # Shallow copy 

560 return copy.copy(v) 

561 # > 

562 

563 # ================== 

564 # Options 

565 # ================== 

566 # < 

567 # --- Column Definitions --- 

568 # Set a definition 

569 def set_defn(self, col, defn, _warnmode=0): 

570 r"""Set a column definition, with checks 

571 

572 :Call: 

573 >>> db.set_defn(col, defn, _warnmode=0) 

574 :Inputs: 

575 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

576 Data container 

577 *col*: :class:`str` 

578 Data column name 

579 *defn*: :class:`dict` 

580 (Partial) definition for *col* 

581 *_warnmode*: {``0``} | ``1`` | ``2`` 

582 Warning mode for invalid *defn* keys or values 

583 :Versions: 

584 * 2020-03-06 ``@ddalle``: Documented 

585 """ 

586 # Get dictionary of options 

587 defns = self.__dict__.setdefault("defns", {}) 

588 # Create filtered definition 

589 defn_checked = self._defncls(_warnmode=_warnmode, **defn) 

590 # Set definition 

591 defns[col] = defn_checked 

592 

593 # --- Copy/Link --- 

594 # Link options 

595 def clone_options(self, opts, prefix=""): 

596 r"""Copy a database's options 

597 

598 :Call: 

599 >>> db.clone_options(opts, prefix="") 

600 :Inputs: 

601 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

602 Data container 

603 *opts*: :class:`dict` 

604 Options dictionary 

605 *prefix*: {``""``} | :class:`str` 

606 Prefix to append to key names in *db.opts* 

607 :Effects: 

608 *db.opts*: :class:`dict` 

609 Options merged with or copied from *opts* 

610 *db.defns*: :class:`dict` 

611 Merged with ``opts["Definitions"]`` 

612 :Versions: 

613 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

614 * 2019-12-26 ``@ddalle``: Added *db.defns* effect 

615 * 2020-02-10 ``@ddalle``: Removed *db.defns* effect 

616 * 2020-03-06 ``@ddalle``: Renamed from :func:`copy_options` 

617 """ 

618 # Check input 

619 if not isinstance(opts, dict): 

620 raise TypeError("Options input must be dict-type") 

621 # Get options 

622 dbopts = self.__dict__.setdefault("opts", {}) 

623 # Merge options 

624 for (k, v) in opts.items(): 

625 # Apply prefix 

626 if prefix: 

627 # Add strings; no delimiter 

628 k1 = prefix + k 

629 else: 

630 # No prefix 

631 k1 = k 

632 # Check for "Definitions"; handled separately 

633 if k1 == "Definitions": 

634 continue 

635 # Get existing value 

636 v0 = dbopts.get(k1) 

637 # Check types 

638 if isinstance(v, dict) and isinstance(v0, dict): 

639 # Update dictionary 

640 v0.update(**v) 

641 else: 

642 # Overwrite or add 

643 dbopts[k] = v 

644 

645 # Link definitions 

646 def clone_defns(self, defns, prefix="", _warnmode=0): 

647 r"""Copy a data store's column definitions 

648 

649 :Call: 

650 >>> db.clone_defns(defns, prefix="") 

651 :Inputs: 

652 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

653 Data container 

654 *defns*: :class:`dict` 

655 Dictionary of column definitions 

656 *prefix*: {``""``} | :class:`str` 

657 Prefix to append to key names in *db.opts* 

658 :Effects: 

659 *db.opts*: :class:`dict` 

660 Options merged with or copied from *opts* 

661 *db.defns*: :class:`dict` 

662 Merged with ``opts["Definitions"]`` 

663 :Versions: 

664 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

665 * 2019-12-26 ``@ddalle``: Added *db.defns* effect 

666 * 2020-02-13 ``@ddalle``: Split from :func:`copy_options` 

667 * 2020-03-06 ``@ddalle``: Renamed from :func:`copy_defns` 

668 """ 

669 # Check input 

670 if not isinstance(defns, dict): 

671 raise TypeError( 

672 "'defns' input must be 'dict', got '%s'" % defns.__class__) 

673 # Loop through input definitions 

674 for (k, defn) in defns.items(): 

675 # Check definition type 

676 if not isinstance(defn, dict): 

677 raise TypeError( 

678 ("Definition for col '%s' " % k) + 

679 ("must be 'dict', got '%s'" % defns.__class__)) 

680 # Apply prefix 

681 if prefix: 

682 # Prepend column name 

683 col = prefix + k 

684 else: 

685 # Reuse column name 

686 col = k 

687 # Save the definition (in database format) 

688 self.set_defn(col, defn, _warnmode) 

689 

690 # --- Definitions: Get --- 

691 # Get output dimension 

692 def get_ndim(self, col): 

693 r"""Get database dimension for column *col* 

694 

695 :Call: 

696 >>> ndim = db.get_ndim(col) 

697 :Inputs: 

698 *db*: :class:`cape.attdb.rdbscalar.DBResponseLinear` 

699 Database with multidimensional output functions 

700 *col*: :class:`str` 

701 Name of column to evaluate 

702 :Outputs: 

703 *ndim*: {``0``} | :class:`int` 

704 Dimension of *col* in database 

705 :Versions: 

706 * 2020-03-12 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

707 """ 

708 # Get column definition 

709 defn = self.get_defn(col) 

710 # Get dimensionality 

711 ndim = defn.get("Dimension") 

712 # Check valid result 

713 if isinstance(ndim, int): 

714 return ndim 

715 # Otherwise, get data 

716 V = self.get_all_values(col) 

717 # Check 

718 if isinstance(V, np.ndarray): 

719 # Get dimensions directly from data 

720 ndim = V.ndim 

721 # Save it 

722 defn["Dimension"] = ndim 

723 defn["Shape"] = V.shape 

724 elif V is None: 

725 # No dimension 

726 return 

727 else: 

728 # List is 1-dimensional 

729 ndim = 1 

730 # Output 

731 return ndim 

732 

733 # Get output dimension 

734 def get_output_ndim(self, col): 

735 r"""Get output dimension for column *col* 

736 

737 :Call: 

738 >>> ndim = db.get_output_ndim(col) 

739 :Inputs: 

740 *db*: :class:`cape.attdb.rdbscalar.DBResponseLinear` 

741 Database with multidimensional output functions 

742 *col*: :class:`str` 

743 Name of column to evaluate 

744 :Outputs: 

745 *ndim*: {``0``} | :class:`int` 

746 Dimension of *col* at a single condition 

747 :Versions: 

748 * 2019-12-27 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

749 * 2020-03-12 ``@ddalle``: Keyed from "Dimension" 

750 """ 

751 # Get column dimension 

752 ndim = self.get_ndim(col) 

753 # Check for miss 

754 if ndim is None: 

755 # No dimension 

756 return 

757 else: 

758 # Subtract one 

759 return ndim - 1 

760 

761 # --- Definitions: Set --- 

762 # Set dimensionality 

763 def set_ndim(self, col, ndim): 

764 r"""Set database dimension for column *col* 

765 

766 :Call: 

767 >>> db.set_ndim(col, ndim) 

768 :Inputs: 

769 *db*: :class:`cape.attdb.rdbscalar.DBResponseLinear` 

770 Database with multidimensional output functions 

771 *col*: :class:`str` 

772 Name of column to evaluate 

773 :Outputs: 

774 *ndim*: {``0``} | :class:`int` 

775 Dimension of *col* in database 

776 :Versions: 

777 * 2019-12-30 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

778 """ 

779 # Get column definition 

780 defn = self.get_defn(col) 

781 # Default 

782 if ndim is None: 

783 # Assume scalar 

784 ndim = 1 

785 # Check type 

786 if not isinstance(ndim, int): 

787 raise TypeError( 

788 "Output dimension for '%s' must be int (got %s)" % 

789 (col, type(ndim))) 

790 # Set it 

791 defn["Dimension"] = ndim 

792 

793 # Set output dimensionality 

794 def set_output_ndim(self, col, ndim): 

795 r"""Set output dimension for column *col* 

796 

797 :Call: 

798 >>> db.set_output_ndim(col, ndim) 

799 :Inputs: 

800 *db*: :class:`cape.attdb.rdbscalar.DBResponseLinear` 

801 Database with multidimensional output functions 

802 *col*: :class:`str` 

803 Name of column to evaluate 

804 :Outputs: 

805 *ndim*: {``0``} | :class:`int` 

806 Dimension of *col* at a single condition 

807 :Versions: 

808 * 2019-12-30 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

809 """ 

810 # Get column definition 

811 defn = self.get_defn(col) 

812 # Default 

813 if ndim is None: 

814 # Assume scalar output 

815 ndim = 0 

816 # Check type 

817 if not isinstance(ndim, int): 

818 raise TypeError( 

819 "Output dimension for '%s' must be int (got %s)" % 

820 (col, type(ndim))) 

821 # Set it 

822 defn["Dimension"] = ndim + 1 

823 # > 

824 

825 # ================ 

826 # Sources 

827 # ================ 

828 # < 

829 # --- Get Source --- 

830 # Get a source by type and number 

831 def get_source(self, ext=None, n=None): 

832 r"""Get a source by category (and number), if possible 

833 

834 :Call: 

835 >>> dbf = db.get_source(ext) 

836 >>> dbf = db.get_source(ext, n) 

837 :Inputs: 

838 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

839 Generic database 

840 *ext*: {``None``} | :class:`str` 

841 Source type, by extension, to retrieve 

842 *n*: {``None``} | :class:`int` >= 0 

843 Source number 

844 :Outputs: 

845 *dbf*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.basefile.BaseFile` 

846 Data file interface 

847 :Versions: 

848 * 2020-02-13 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

849 """ 

850 # Get sources 

851 srcs = self.__dict__.get("sources", {}) 

852 # Check for *n* 

853 if n is None: 

854 # Check for both ``None`` 

855 if ext is None: 

856 raise ValueError("Either 'ext' or 'n' must be specified") 

857 # Loop through sources 

858 for name, dbf in srcs.items(): 

859 # Check name 

860 if name.split("-")[1] == ext: 

861 # Output 

862 return dbf 

863 else: 

864 # No match 

865 return 

866 elif ext is None: 

867 # Check names 

868 targ = "%02i" % n 

869 # Loop through sources 

870 for name, dbf in srcs.items(): 

871 # Check name 

872 if name.split("-")[0] == targ: 

873 # Output 

874 return dbf 

875 else: 

876 # No match 

877 return 

878 else: 

879 # Get explicit name 

880 name = "%02i-%s" % (n, ext) 

881 # Check for source 

882 return srcs.get(name) 

883 

884 # Get source, creating if necessary 

885 def make_source(self, ext, cls, n=None, cols=None, save=True, **kw): 

886 r"""Get or create a source by category (and number) 

887 

888 :Call: 

889 >>> dbf = db.make_source(ext, cls) 

890 >>> dbf = db.make_source(ext, cls, n=None, cols=None, **kw) 

891 :Inputs: 

892 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

893 Generic database 

894 *ext*: :class:`str` 

895 Source type, by extension, to retrieve 

896 *cls*: :class:`type` 

897 Subclass of :class:`BaseFile` to create (if needed) 

898 *n*: {``None``} | :class:`int` >= 0 

899 Source number to search for 

900 *cols*: {*db.cols*} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

901 List of data columns to include in *dbf* 

902 *save*: {``True``} | ``False`` 

903 Option to save *dbf* in *db.sources* 

904 *attrs*: {``None``} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

905 Extra attributes of *db* to save for ``.mat`` files 

906 :Outputs: 

907 *dbf*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.basefile.BaseFile` 

908 Data file interface 

909 :Versions: 

910 * 2020-02-13 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

911 * 2020-03-06 ``@ddalle``: Rename from :func:`get_dbf` 

912 """ 

913 # Don't use existing if *cols* is specified 

914 if cols is None and kw.get("attrs") is None: 

915 # Get the source 

916 dbf = self.get_source(ext, n=n) 

917 # Check if found 

918 if dbf is not None: 

919 # Done 

920 return dbf 

921 # Create a new one 

922 dbf = self.genr8_source(ext, cls, cols=cols, **kw) 

923 # Save the file interface if needed 

924 if save: 

925 # Name for this source 

926 name = "%02i-%s" % (len(self.sources), ext) 

927 # Save it 

928 self.sources[name] = dbf 

929 # Output 

930 return dbf 

931 

932 # Build new source, creating if necessary 

933 def genr8_source(self, ext, cls, cols=None, **kw): 

934 r"""Create a new source file interface 

935 

936 :Call: 

937 >>> dbf = db.genr8_source(ext, cls) 

938 >>> dbf = db.genr8_source(ext, cls, cols=None, **kw) 

939 :Inputs: 

940 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

941 Generic database 

942 *ext*: :class:`str` 

943 Source type, by extension, to retrieve 

944 *cls*: :class:`type` 

945 Subclass of :class:`BaseFile` to create (if needed) 

946 *cols*: {*db.cols*} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

947 List of data columns to include in *dbf* 

948 *attrs*: {``None``} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

949 Extra attributes of *db* to save for ``.mat`` files 

950 :Outputs: 

951 *dbf*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.basefile.BaseFile` 

952 Data file interface 

953 :Versions: 

954 * 2020-03-06 ``@ddalle``: Split from :func:`make_source` 

955 """ 

956 # Default columns 

957 if cols is None: 

958 # Use listed columns 

959 cols = list(self.cols) 

960 # Get relevant options 

961 kwcls = {"_warnmode": 0} 

962 # Set values 

963 kwcls["Values"] = {col: self[col] for col in cols} 

964 # Explicit column list 

965 kwcls["cols"] = cols 

966 # Copy definitions 

967 kwcls["Definitions"] = self.defns 

968 # Create from class 

969 dbf = cls(**kwcls) 

970 # Get attributes to copy 

971 attrs = kw.get("attrs") 

972 # Copy them 

973 self._copy_attrs(dbf, attrs) 

974 # Output 

975 return dbf 

976 

977 # Copy attributes 

978 def _copy_attrs(self, dbf, attrs): 

979 r"""Copy additional attributes to new "source" database 

980 

981 :Call: 

982 >>> db._copy_attrs(dbf, attrs) 

983 :Inputs: 

984 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

985 Generic database 

986 *dbf*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.basefile.BaseFile` 

987 Data file interface 

988 *attrs*: ``None`` | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

989 List of *db* attributes to copy 

990 :Versions: 

991 * 2020-04-30 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

992 """ 

993 # Check for null option 

994 if attrs is None: 

995 return 

996 # Loop through attributes 

997 for attr in attrs: 

998 # Get current value 

999 v = self.__dict__.get(attr) 

1000 # Check for :class:`dict` 

1001 if not isinstance(v, dict): 

1002 # Copy attribute and move to next attribute 

1003 setattr(dbf, attr, copy.copy(v)) 

1004 continue 

1005 # Check if this is a dict of information by column 

1006 if not any([col in v for col in dbf]): 

1007 # Just some other :class:`dict`; copy whole hting 

1008 setattr(dbf, attr, copy.copy(v)) 

1009 # Initialize dict to save 

1010 v1 = {} 

1011 # Loop through cols 

1012 for col, vi in v.items(): 

1013 # Check if it's a *col* in *dbf* 

1014 if col in dbf: 

1015 v1[col] = copy.copy(vi) 

1016 # Save new :class:`dict` 

1017 setattr(dbf, attr, v1) 

1018 # > 

1019 

1020 # ================== 

1021 # I/O 

1022 # ================== 

1023 # < 

1024 # --- CSV --- 

1025 # Read CSV file 

1026 def read_csv(self, fname, **kw): 

1027 r"""Read data from a CSV file 

1028 

1029 :Call: 

1030 >>> db.read_csv(fname, **kw) 

1031 >>> db.read_csv(dbcsv, **kw) 

1032 >>> db.read_csv(f, **kw) 

1033 :Inputs: 

1034 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1035 Generic database 

1036 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1037 Name of CSV file to read 

1038 *dbcsv*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.csvfile.CSVFile` 

1039 Existing CSV file 

1040 *f*: :class:`file` 

1041 Open CSV file interface 

1042 *append*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1043 Option to combine cols with same name 

1044 *save*, *SaveCSV*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1045 Option to save the CSV interface to *db._csv* 

1046 :See Also: 

1047 * :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.csvfile.CSVFile` 

1048 :Versions: 

1049 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1050 """ 

1051 # Get option to save database 

1052 save = kw.pop("save", kw.pop("SaveCSV", False)) 

1053 # Set warning mode 

1054 kw.setdefault("_warnmode", 0) 

1055 # Check input type 

1056 if isinstance(fname, ftypes.CSVFile): 

1057 # Already a CSV database 

1058 dbf = fname 

1059 else: 

1060 # Create an instance 

1061 dbf = ftypes.CSVFile(fname, **kw) 

1062 # Link the data 

1063 self.link_data(dbf, append=kw.get("append", False)) 

1064 # Copy the options 

1065 self.clone_defns(dbf.defns) 

1066 # Apply default 

1067 self.finish_defns(dbf.cols) 

1068 # Save the file interface if needed 

1069 if save: 

1070 # Name for this source 

1071 name = "%02i-csv" % len(self.sources) 

1072 # Save it 

1073 self.sources[name] = dbf 

1074 

1075 # Write dense CSV file 

1076 def write_csv_dense(self, fname, cols=None): 

1077 r""""Write dense CSV file 

1078 

1079 If *db.sources* has a CSV file, the database will be written 

1080 from that object. Otherwise, :func:`make_source` is called. 

1081 

1082 :Call: 

1083 >>> db.write_csv_dense(fname, cols=None) 

1084 >>> db.write_csv_dense(f, cols=None) 

1085 :Inputs: 

1086 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1087 Data container 

1088 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1089 Name of file to write 

1090 *f*: :class:`file` 

1091 File open for writing 

1092 *cols*: {*db.cols*} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1093 List of columns to write 

1094 :Versions: 

1095 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1096 * 2020-02-14 ``@ddalle``: Uniform "sources" interface 

1097 """ 

1098 # Get CSV file interface 

1099 dbcsv = self.make_source("csv", ftypes.CSVFile, cols=cols) 

1100 # Write it 

1101 dbcsv.write_csv_dense(fname, cols=cols) 

1102 

1103 # Write (nice) CSV file 

1104 def write_csv(self, fname, cols=None, **kw): 

1105 r""""Write CSV file with full options 

1106 

1107 If *db.sources* has a CSV file, the database will be written 

1108 from that object. Otherwise, :func:`make_source` is called. 

1109 

1110 :Call: 

1111 >>> db.write_csv(fname, cols=None, **kw) 

1112 >>> db.write_csv(f, cols=None, **kw) 

1113 :Inputs: 

1114 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1115 Data container 

1116 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1117 Name of file to write 

1118 *f*: :class:`file` 

1119 File open for writing 

1120 *cols*: {*db.cols*} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1121 List of columns to write 

1122 *kw*: :class:`dict` 

1123 Keyword args to :func:`CSVFile.write_csv` 

1124 :Versions: 

1125 * 2020-04-01 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1126 """ 

1127 # Get CSV file interface 

1128 dbcsv = self.make_source("csv", ftypes.CSVFile, cols=cols) 

1129 # Write it 

1130 dbcsv.write_csv(fname, cols=cols, **kw) 

1131 

1132 # --- Simple CSV --- 

1133 # Read simple CSV file 

1134 def read_csvsimple(self, fname, **kw): 

1135 r"""Read data from a simple CSV file 

1136 

1137 :Call: 

1138 >>> db.read_csvsimple(fname, **kw) 

1139 >>> db.read_csvsimple(dbcsv, **kw) 

1140 >>> db.read_csvsimple(f, **kw) 

1141 :Inputs: 

1142 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1143 Generic database 

1144 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1145 Name of CSV file to read 

1146 *dbcsv*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.csvfile.CSVSimple` 

1147 Existing CSV file 

1148 *f*: :class:`file` 

1149 Open CSV file interface 

1150 *save*, *SaveCSV*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1151 Option to save the CSV interface to *db._csv* 

1152 :See Also: 

1153 * :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.csvfile.CSVFile` 

1154 :Versions: 

1155 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1156 """ 

1157 # Get option to save database 

1158 savecsv = kw.pop("save", kw.pop("SaveCSV", False)) 

1159 # Set warning mode 

1160 kw.setdefault("_warnmode", 0) 

1161 # Check input type 

1162 if isinstance(fname, ftypes.CSVSimple): 

1163 # Already a CSV database 

1164 dbf = fname 

1165 else: 

1166 # Create an instance 

1167 dbf = ftypes.CSVSimple(fname, **kw) 

1168 # Link the data 

1169 self.link_data(dbf) 

1170 # Copy the definitions 

1171 self.clone_defns(dbf.defns) 

1172 # Apply default 

1173 self.finish_defns(dbf.cols) 

1174 # Save the file interface if needed 

1175 if save: 

1176 # Name for this source 

1177 name = "%02i-csvsimple" % len(self.sources) 

1178 # Save it 

1179 self.sources[name] = dbf 

1180 

1181 # --- TSV --- 

1182 # Read TSV file 

1183 def read_tsv(self, fname, **kw): 

1184 r"""Read data from a space-separated file 

1185 

1186 :Call: 

1187 >>> db.read_tsv(fname, **kw) 

1188 >>> db.read_tsv(dbtsv, **kw) 

1189 >>> db.read_tsv(f, **kw) 

1190 :Inputs: 

1191 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1192 Generic database 

1193 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1194 Name of TSV file to read 

1195 *dbcsv*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.tsvfile.TSVFile` 

1196 Existing TSV file 

1197 *f*: :class:`file` 

1198 Open TSV file handle 

1199 *append*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1200 Option to combine cols with same name 

1201 *save*, *SaveTSV*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1202 Option to save the TSV interface to *db.sources* 

1203 :See Also: 

1204 * :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.tsvfile.CSVFile` 

1205 :Versions: 

1206 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 (:func:`read_csv`) 

1207 * 2021-01-14 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1208 """ 

1209 # Get option to save database 

1210 save = kw.pop("save", kw.pop("SaveTSV", False)) 

1211 # Set warning mode 

1212 kw.setdefault("_warnmode", 0) 

1213 # Check input type 

1214 if isinstance(fname, ftypes.TSVFile): 

1215 # Already a CSV database 

1216 dbf = fname 

1217 else: 

1218 # Create an instance 

1219 dbf = ftypes.TSVFile(fname, **kw) 

1220 # Link the data 

1221 self.link_data(dbf, append=kw.get("append", False)) 

1222 # Copy the options 

1223 self.clone_defns(dbf.defns) 

1224 # Apply default 

1225 self.finish_defns(dbf.cols) 

1226 # Save the file interface if needed 

1227 if save: 

1228 # Name for this source 

1229 name = "%02i-tsv" % len(self.sources) 

1230 # Save it 

1231 self.sources[name] = dbf 

1232 

1233 # Write dense TSV file 

1234 def write_tsv_dense(self, fname, cols=None): 

1235 r""""Write dense TSV file 

1236 

1237 If *db.sources* has a TSV file, the database will be written 

1238 from that object. Otherwise, :func:`make_source` is called. 

1239 

1240 :Call: 

1241 >>> db.write_tsv_dense(fname, cols=None) 

1242 >>> db.write_tsv_dense(f, cols=None) 

1243 :Inputs: 

1244 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1245 Data container 

1246 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1247 Name of file to write 

1248 *f*: :class:`file` 

1249 File open for writing 

1250 *cols*: {*db.cols*} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1251 List of columns to write 

1252 :Versions: 

1253 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 (write_csv_dense) 

1254 * 2021-01-14 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1255 """ 

1256 # Get TSV file interface 

1257 dbtsv = self.make_source("tsv", ftypes.TSVFile, cols=cols) 

1258 # Write it 

1259 dbtsv.write_tsv_dense(fname, cols=cols) 

1260 

1261 # Write (nice) TSV file 

1262 def write_tsv(self, fname, cols=None, **kw): 

1263 r""""Write TSV file with full options 

1264 

1265 If *db.sources* has a TSV file, the database will be written 

1266 from that object. Otherwise, :func:`make_source` is called. 

1267 

1268 :Call: 

1269 >>> db.write_tsv(fname, cols=None, **kw) 

1270 >>> db.write_tsv(f, cols=None, **kw) 

1271 :Inputs: 

1272 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1273 Data container 

1274 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1275 Name of file to write 

1276 *f*: :class:`file` 

1277 File open for writing 

1278 *cols*: {*db.cols*} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1279 List of columns to write 

1280 *kw*: :class:`dict` 

1281 Keyword args to :func:`TSVFile.write_tsv` 

1282 :Versions: 

1283 * 2020-04-01 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 (write_csv) 

1284 * 2021-01-14 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1285 """ 

1286 # Get TSV file interface 

1287 dbtsv = self.make_source("tsv", ftypes.TSVFile, cols=cols) 

1288 # Write it 

1289 dbtsv.write_tsv(fname, cols=cols, **kw) 

1290 

1291 # --- Simple TSV --- 

1292 # Read simple TSV file 

1293 def read_tsvsimple(self, fname, **kw): 

1294 r"""Read data from a simple TSV file 

1295 

1296 :Call: 

1297 >>> db.read_tsvsimple(fname, **kw) 

1298 >>> db.read_tsvsimple(dbcsv, **kw) 

1299 >>> db.read_tsvsimple(f, **kw) 

1300 :Inputs: 

1301 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1302 Generic database 

1303 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1304 Name of TSV file to read 

1305 *dbtsv*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.tsvfile.TSVSimple` 

1306 Existing TSV file 

1307 *f*: :class:`file` 

1308 Open TSV file interface 

1309 *save*, *SaveTSV*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1310 Option to save the TSV interface to *db.sources* 

1311 :See Also: 

1312 * :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.tsvfile.TSVFile` 

1313 :Versions: 

1314 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 (read_csvsimple) 

1315 * 2021-01-14 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1316 """ 

1317 # Get option to save database 

1318 save = kw.pop("save", kw.pop("SaveTSV", False)) 

1319 # Set warning mode 

1320 kw.setdefault("_warnmode", 0) 

1321 # Check input type 

1322 if isinstance(fname, ftypes.TSVSimple): 

1323 # Already a CSV database 

1324 dbf = fname 

1325 else: 

1326 # Create an instance 

1327 dbf = ftypes.TSVSimple(fname, **kw) 

1328 # Link the data 

1329 self.link_data(dbf) 

1330 # Copy the definitions 

1331 self.clone_defns(dbf.defns) 

1332 # Apply default 

1333 self.finish_defns(dbf.cols) 

1334 # Save the file interface if needed 

1335 if save: 

1336 # Name for this source 

1337 name = "%02i-tsvsimple" % len(self.sources) 

1338 # Save it 

1339 self.sources[name] = dbf 

1340 

1341 # --- Text Data --- 

1342 # Read text data fiel 

1343 def read_textdata(self, fname, **kw): 

1344 r"""Read data from a simple CSV file 

1345 

1346 :Call: 

1347 >>> db.read_textdata(fname, **kw) 

1348 >>> db.read_textdata(dbcsv, **kw) 

1349 >>> db.read_textdata(f, **kw) 

1350 :Inputs: 

1351 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1352 Generic database 

1353 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1354 Name of CSV file to read 

1355 *dbcsv*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.textdata.TextDataFile` 

1356 Existing CSV file 

1357 *f*: :class:`file` 

1358 Open CSV file interface 

1359 *save*: {``True``} | ``False`` 

1360 Option to save the CSV interface to *db._csv* 

1361 :See Also: 

1362 * :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.csvfile.CSVFile` 

1363 :Versions: 

1364 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1365 """ 

1366 # Get option to save database 

1367 savedat = kw.pop("save", False) 

1368 # Set warning mode 

1369 kw.setdefault("_warnmode", 0) 

1370 # Check input type 

1371 if isinstance(fname, ftypes.TextDataFile): 

1372 # Already a file itnerface 

1373 dbf = fname 

1374 else: 

1375 # Create an insteance 

1376 dbf = ftypes.TextDataFile(fname, **kw) 

1377 # Linke the data 

1378 self.link_data(dbf) 

1379 # Copy the definitions 

1380 self.clone_defns(dbf.defns) 

1381 # Apply default 

1382 self.finish_defns(dbf.cols) 

1383 # Save the file interface if needed 

1384 if savedat: 

1385 # Name for this source 

1386 name = "%02i-textdata" % len(self.sources) 

1387 # Save it 

1388 self.sources[name] = dbf 

1389 

1390 # --- XLS --- 

1391 # Read XLS file 

1392 def read_xls(self, fname, **kw): 

1393 r"""Read data from an ``.xls`` or ``.xlsx`` file 

1394 

1395 :Call: 

1396 >>> db.read_xls(fname, **kw) 

1397 >>> db.read_xls(dbxls, **kw) 

1398 >>> db.read_xls(wb, **kw) 

1399 >>> db.read_xls(ws, **kw) 

1400 :Inputs: 

1401 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1402 Generic database 

1403 *dbxls*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.xls.XLSFile` 

1404 Existing XLS file interface 

1405 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1406 Name of ``.xls`` or ``.xlsx`` file to read 

1407 *sheet*: {``0``} | :class:`int` | :class:`str` 

1408 Worksheet name or number 

1409 *wb*: :class:`xlrd.book.Book` 

1410 Open workbook (spreadsheet file) 

1411 *ws*: :class:`xlrd.sheet.Sheet` 

1412 Direct access to a worksheet 

1413 *skiprows*: {``None``} | :class:`int` >= 0 

1414 Number of rows to skip before reading data 

1415 *subrows*: {``0``} | :class:`int` > 0 

1416 Number of rows below header row to skip 

1417 *skipcols*: {``None``} | :class:`int` >= 0 

1418 Number of columns to skip before first data column 

1419 *maxrows*: {``None``} | :class:`int` > *skiprows* 

1420 Maximum row number of data 

1421 *maxcols*: {``None``} | :class:`int` > *skipcols* 

1422 Maximum column number of data 

1423 *save*, *SaveXLS*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1424 Option to save the XLS interface to *db._xls* 

1425 :See Also: 

1426 * :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.xls.XLSFile` 

1427 :Versions: 

1428 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1429 """ 

1430 # Get option to save database 

1431 save = kw.pop("save", kw.pop("SaveXLS", False)) 

1432 # Set warning mode 

1433 kw.setdefault("_warnmode", 0) 

1434 # Check input type 

1435 if isinstance(fname, ftypes.XLSFile): 

1436 # Already a CSV database 

1437 dbf = fname 

1438 else: 

1439 # Create an instance 

1440 dbf = ftypes.XLSFile(fname, **kw) 

1441 # Link the data 

1442 self.link_data(dbf) 

1443 # Copy the definitions 

1444 self.clone_defns(dbf.defns) 

1445 # Apply default 

1446 self.finish_defns(dbf.cols) 

1447 # Save the file interface if needed 

1448 if save: 

1449 # Name for this source 

1450 name = "%02i-xls" % len(self.sources) 

1451 # Save it 

1452 self.sources[name] = dbf 

1453 

1454 # Write XLSX file 

1455 def write_xls(self, fname, cols=None, **kw): 

1456 r""""Write XLS file with full options 

1457 

1458 If *db.sources* has a XLS file, the database will be written 

1459 from that object. Otherwise, :func:`make_source` is called. 

1460 

1461 :Call: 

1462 >>> db.write_xls(fname, cols=None, **kw) 

1463 >>> db.write_xls(wb, cols=None, **kw) 

1464 :Inputs: 

1465 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1466 Data container 

1467 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1468 Name of file to write 

1469 *wb*: :class:`xlsxwriter.Workbook` 

1470 Opened XLS workbook 

1471 *cols*: {*db.cols*} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1472 List of columns to write 

1473 *kw*: :class:`dict` 

1474 Keyword args to :func:`CSVFile.write_csv` 

1475 :Versions: 

1476 * 2020-05-21 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1477 """ 

1478 # Get column names per sheet 

1479 sheetcols = kw.get("sheetcols", {}) 

1480 # Full set of such cols 

1481 if cols is None: 

1482 # Default: all columns 

1483 cols = self.cols 

1484 # Initialize with specified cols 

1485 allcols = list(cols) 

1486 # Combine all columns from *sheetcols* 

1487 for _cols in sheetcols.values(): 

1488 allcols.update(_cols) 

1489 # Get XLS file interface 

1490 dbxls = self.make_source("xls", ftypes.XLSFile, cols=allcols) 

1491 # Write it 

1492 dbxls.write_xls(fname, cols=cols, **kw) 

1493 

1494 # --- MAT --- 

1495 # Read MAT file 

1496 def read_mat(self, fname, **kw): 

1497 r"""Read data from a version 5 ``.mat`` file 

1498 

1499 :Call: 

1500 >>> db.read_mat(fname, **kw) 

1501 >>> db.read_mat(dbmat, **kw) 

1502 :Inputs: 

1503 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1504 Generic database 

1505 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1506 Name of ``.mat`` file to read 

1507 *dbmat*: :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.mat.MATFile` 

1508 Existing MAT file interface 

1509 *save*, *SaveMAT*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1510 Option to save the MAT interface to *db._mat* 

1511 :See Also: 

1512 * :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.mat.MATFile` 

1513 :Versions: 

1514 * 2019-12-17 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1515 """ 

1516 # Get option to save database 

1517 save = kw.pop("save", kw.pop("SaveMAT", False)) 

1518 # Set warning mode 

1519 kw.setdefault("_warnmode", 0) 

1520 # Check input type 

1521 if isinstance(fname, ftypes.MATFile): 

1522 # Already a MAT database 

1523 dbf = fname 

1524 else: 

1525 # Create an instance 

1526 dbf = ftypes.MATFile(fname, **kw) 

1527 # Columns to keep 

1528 cols = [] 

1529 # Make replacements for column names 

1530 for (j, col) in enumerate(dbf.cols): 

1531 # Check name 

1532 if col.startswith("DB."): 

1533 # Strip prefix from name 

1534 col1 = col[3:] 

1535 # Replace key 

1536 dbf[col1] = dbf.pop(col) 

1537 # Save this column 

1538 cols.append(col1) 

1539 elif col.startswith("bkpts."): 

1540 # Strip "bkpts" from name 

1541 col1 = col[6:] 

1542 # Create break points 

1543 bkpts = self.__dict__.setdefault("bkpts", {}) 

1544 # Save them 

1545 bkpts[col1] = dbf.pop(col) 

1546 else: 

1547 # No change; save this column 

1548 cols.append(col) 

1549 # Subset column list 

1550 dbf.cols = cols 

1551 # Link the data 

1552 self.link_data(dbf) 

1553 # Copy the definitions 

1554 self.clone_defns(dbf.defns) 

1555 # Apply default 

1556 self.finish_defns(dbf.cols) 

1557 # Link other attributes 

1558 for (k, v) in dbf.__dict__.items(): 

1559 # Check if present and nonempty 

1560 if self.__dict__.get(k): 

1561 continue 

1562 # Otherwise link 

1563 self.__dict__[k] = v 

1564 # Save the file interface if needed 

1565 if save: 

1566 # Name for this source 

1567 name = "%02i-mat" % len(self.sources) 

1568 # Save it 

1569 self.sources[name] = dbf 

1570 

1571 # Write MAT file 

1572 def write_mat(self, fname, cols=None, **kw): 

1573 r""""Write a MAT file 

1574 

1575 If *db.sources* has a MAT file, the database will be written 

1576 from that object. Otherwise, :func:`make_source` is called. 

1577 

1578 :Call: 

1579 >>> db.write_mat(fname, cols=None) 

1580 :Inputs: 

1581 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1582 Data container 

1583 *fname*: :class:`str` 

1584 Name of file to write 

1585 *f*: :class:`file` 

1586 File open for writing 

1587 *cols*: {*db.cols*} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1588 List of columns to write 

1589 :Versions: 

1590 * 2019-12-06 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1591 """ 

1592 # Attributes 

1593 attrs = kw.get("attrs", ["bkpts"]) 

1594 # Get/create MAT file interface 

1595 dbmat = self.make_source("mat", ftypes.MATFile, cols=cols, attrs=attrs) 

1596 # Write it 

1597 dbmat.write_mat(fname, cols=cols, attrs=attrs) 

1598 

1599 # --- RBF specials --- 

1600 def infer_rbfs(self, cols, **kw): 

1601 r"""Infer radial basis function responses for several *cols* 

1602 

1603 :Call: 

1604 >>> db.infer_rbfs(cols, **kw) 

1605 :Inputs: 

1606 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1607 DataKit where *db.rbf[col]* will be defined 

1608 *cols*: :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1609 Name of column whose RBF will be constructed 

1610 *xcols*: {``None``} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1611 Explicit list of arguments for all *cols* 

1612 :See Also: 

1613 * :func:`infer_rbf` 

1614 * :func:`create_rbf_cols` 

1615 :Versions: 

1616 * 2021-09-16 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1617 """ 

1618 # Infer RBF for each *col* 

1619 for col in cols: 

1620 self.infer_rbf(col, **kw) 

1621 

1622 # Infer RBF from cols with expected suffixes 

1623 def infer_rbf(self, col, vals=None, **kw): 

1624 r"""Infer a radial basis function response mechanism 

1625 

1626 This looks for columns with specific suffixes in order to create 

1627 a Radial Basis Function (RBF) response mechanism in *db*. 

1628 Suppose that *col* is ``"CY"`` for this example, then this 

1629 function will look for the following columns, either in *col* or 

1630 *vals*: 

1631 

1632 * ``"CY"``: nominal values at which RBF was created 

1633 * ``"CY_method"``: response method index 

1634 * ``"CY_rbf"``: weights of RBF nodes 

1635 * ``"CY_func"``: RBF basis function index 

1636 * ``"CY_eps"``: scaling parameter for (each) RBF 

1637 * ``"CY_smooth:``: RBF smoothing parameter 

1638 * ``"CY_N"``: number of nodes in (each) RBF 

1639 * ``"CY_xcols"``: explicit list of RBF argument names 

1640 * ``"CY_X"``: 2D matrix of values of RBF args 

1641 * ``"CY_x0"``: values of first argument if not global RBF 

1642 

1643 The *CY_method* column will repeat one of the following values: 

1644 

1645 * ``4``: ``"rbf"`` 

1646 * ``5``: ``"rbf-map"`` 

1647 * ``6``: ``"rbf-schedule"`` 

1648 

1649 The *CY_func* legend is as follows: 

1650 

1651 * ``0``: ``"multiquadric"`` 

1652 * ``1``: ``"inverse_multiquadric"`` 

1653 * ``2``: ``"gaussian"`` 

1654 * ``3``: ``"linear"`` 

1655 * ``4``: ``"cubic"`` 

1656 * ``5``: ``"quintic"`` 

1657 * ``6``: ``"thin_plate"`` 

1658  

1659 :Call: 

1660 >>> db.infer_rbf(col, vals=None, **kw) 

1661 :Inputs: 

1662 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1663 DataKit where *db.rbf[col]* will be defined 

1664 *col*: :class:`str` 

1665 Name of column whose RBF will be constructed 

1666 *vals*: :class:`dict`\ [:class:`np.ndarray`] 

1667 Data to use in RBF creation in favor of *db* 

1668 :Effects: 

1669 *db[col]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1670 Values of *col* used in RBF 

1671 *db[xcol]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1672 Values of RBF args saved for each *xcol* 

1673 *db.bkpts[xcol]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1674 Break points for each RBF arg 

1675 *db.rbf[col]*: :class:`Rbf` | :class:`list` 

1676 One or more SciPy radial basis function instances 

1677 *db.response_methods[col]*: :class:`str` 

1678 Name of inferred response method 

1679 :Versions: 

1680 * 2021-09-16 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1681 """ 

1682 # --- Options --- 

1683 # --- Get values --- 

1684 # Default *vals* dict of extra columns 

1685 if vals is None: 

1686 vals = {} 

1687 # Special column names 

1688 col0 = col 

1689 col2 = "%s_rbf" % col 

1690 col3 = "%s_func" % col 

1691 col4 = "%s_eps" % col 

1692 col5 = "%s_smooth" % col 

1693 col6 = "%s_N" % col 

1694 # Extract values 

1695 v = vals.get(col0, self.get(col0)) 

1696 v_rbf = vals.get(col2, self.get(col2)) 

1697 v_func = vals.get(col3, self.get(col3)) 

1698 v_eps = vals.get(col4, self.get(col4)) 

1699 v_smth = vals.get(col5, self.get(col5)) 

1700 v_N = vals.get(col6, self.get(col6)) 

1701 # Get arg values 

1702 v_X = self._infer_response_x(col, vals, **kw) 

1703 # Get list of arguments 

1704 xcols = self._infer_xcols(col, vals, **kw) 

1705 # Get response method 

1706 imeth, eval_meth = self._infer_response_method(col, vals) 

1707 # Check if method is an RBF 

1708 if eval_meth not in RBF_METHODS: 

1709 raise ValueError( 

1710 "eval_method '%s' (index %i) is not an RBF" 

1711 % (eval_meth, imeth)) 

1712 # --- RBFs --- 

1713 # (Total) number of test points 

1714 nx = v.size 

1715 # Entries for uniform cols 

1716 nx2 = v_eps.size 

1717 # Number of RBF args 

1718 narg = v_X.shape[1] 

1719 # Create dummy inputs for blank RBF 

1720 Z = ([0.0, 1.0],) * narg 

1721 # Number of RBFs (potentially) 

1722 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

1723 # %%% Global RBF %%% 

1724 # Read function type 

1725 func = RBF_FUNCS[int(v_func[0])] 

1726 # Create RBF 

1727 rbf = scirbf.Rbf(*Z, function=func) 

1728 # Save not-too-important actual values 

1729 rbf.di = v 

1730 # Use all conditions 

1731 rbf.xi = v_X.T 

1732 # Get RBF weights 

1733 rbf.nodes = v_rbf 

1734 # Get function type 

1735 rbf.function = func 

1736 # Get scale factor 

1737 rbf.epsilon = v_eps[0] 

1738 # Smoothing parameter 

1739 rbf.smooth = v_smth[0] 

1740 # Save count 

1741 rbf.N = nx 

1742 # Save RBF 

1743 self.rbf[col] = rbf 

1744 # Save args to main db (overwrite) 

1745 for j, xcol in enumerate(xcols): 

1746 # Get values 

1747 xj = v_X[:, j] 

1748 # Save them 

1749 self.save_col(xcol, xj) 

1750 # Create break point tables 

1751 self.create_bkpts(xcols, nmin=1) 

1752 else: 

1753 # %%% Multiple RBFS %%% 

1754 # Get *x0* values 

1755 v_x0 = self._infer_response_x0(col, vals, **kw) 

1756 # Get unique values of first *xcol* 

1757 x0_bkpts = np.unique(v_x0) 

1758 # Count unique values 

1759 nrbf = x0_bkpts.size 

1760 # Expand *x0* if needed 

1761 if nx != nx2: 

1762 # "expand" *v_x0* by repeating each value *v_N* times 

1763 v_x0 = np.hstack( 

1764 [np.full(v_N[j], x0_bkpts[j]) for j in range(nrbf)]) 

1765 # Initialize db.rbf 

1766 self.rbf[col] = [] 

1767 # Loop through RBF slices 

1768 for j, x0j in enumerate(x0_bkpts): 

1769 # Indices for this beginning of slice 

1770 if j == 0: 

1771 ia = 0 

1772 else: 

1773 ia = ib 

1774 # Index from repeated cols 

1775 if nx == nx2: 

1776 # Parameters like *eps* repeated *rbf.N* times 

1777 j2 = ia 

1778 else: 

1779 # Parameters like *eps* only reported once per RBF 

1780 j2 = j 

1781 # End of slice 

1782 ib = ia + int(v_N[j2]) 

1783 # Read function type 

1784 func = RBF_FUNCS[int(v_func[j2])] 

1785 # Create RBF 

1786 rbf = scirbf.Rbf(*Z, function=func) 

1787 # Save not-too-important actual values 

1788 rbf.di = v[ia:ib] 

1789 # Use all conditions 

1790 rbf.xi = v_X[ia:ib,:].T 

1791 # Get RBF weights 

1792 rbf.nodes = v_rbf[ia:ib] 

1793 # Get function type 

1794 rbf.function = func 

1795 # Get scale factor 

1796 rbf.epsilon = v_eps[j2] 

1797 # Smoothing parameter 

1798 rbf.smooth = v_smth[j2] 

1799 # Save count 

1800 rbf.N = v_N[j2] 

1801 # Save RBF 

1802 self.rbf[col].append(rbf) 

1803 # Save first arg 

1804 self.save_col(xcols[0], v_x0) 

1805 # Save args to main db (overwrite) 

1806 for j, xcol in enumerate(xcols[1:]): 

1807 # Get values 

1808 xj = v_X[:, j] 

1809 # Save them 

1810 self.save_col(xcol, xj) 

1811 # Get break points 

1812 self.create_bkpts(xcols[0], nmin=1) 

1813 self.create_bkpts_schedule(xcols[1:], xcols[0], nmin=1) 

1814 # --- Final Definitions --- 

1815 # Save main values 

1816 self.save_col(col, v) 

1817 # Save evaluation method 

1818 self.set_response_method(col, eval_meth) 

1819 # Save response mechanism arguments 

1820 self.set_response_args(col, xcols) 

1821 

1822 # Generate special cols for an RBF 

1823 def create_rbfs_cols(self, cols, **kw): 

1824 r"""Save data to describe multiple existing RBFs 

1825 

1826 :Call: 

1827 >>> db.create_rbfs_cols(cols, **kw) 

1828 :Inputs: 

1829 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1830 DataKit with *db.rbf[col]* defined 

1831 *cols*: :class:`str` 

1832 Name of columns whose RBFs will be archived 

1833 *expand*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1834 Repeat properties like *eps* for each node of RBF 

1835 (for uniform data size, usually to write to CSV file) 

1836 :See Also: 

1837 * :func:`create_rbf_cols` 

1838 * :func:`infer_rbfs` 

1839 * :func:`infer_rbf` 

1840 :Versions: 

1841 * 2021-09-16 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1842 """ 

1843 # Loop through column list 

1844 for col in cols: 

1845 self.create_rbf_cols(col, **kw) 

1846 

1847 def create_rbf_cols(self, col, **kw): 

1848 r"""Generate data to describe existing RBF(s) for *col* 

1849 

1850 This saves various properties extracted from *db.rbf[col]* 

1851 directly as additional columns in *db*. These values can then be 

1852 used but :func:`infer_rbf` to reconstruct a SciPy radial basis 

1853 function response mechanism without re-solving the original 

1854 linear system of equations that trains the RBF weights. 

1855  

1856 :Call: 

1857 >>> db.create_rbf_cols(col, **kw) 

1858 :Inputs: 

1859 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1860 DataKit with *db.rbf[col]* defined 

1861 *col*: :class:`str` 

1862 Name of column whose RBF will be analyzed 

1863 *expand*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1864 Repeat properties like *eps* for each node of RBF 

1865 (for uniform data size, usually to write to CSV file) 

1866 :Effects: 

1867 *db[col]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1868 Values of *col* used in RBF 

1869 *db[col+"_method"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`int`] 

1870 Response method index: 

1871 

1872 * ``4``: ``"rbf"`` 

1873 * ``5``: ``"rbf-map"`` 

1874 * ``6``: ``"rbf-schedule"`` 

1875 

1876 *db[col+"_rbf"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1877 Weight for each RBF node 

1878 *db[col+"_func"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`int`] 

1879 RBF basis function index: 

1880 

1881 * ``0``: ``"multiquadric"`` 

1882 * ``1``: ``"inverse_multiquadric"`` 

1883 * ``2``: ``"gaussian"`` 

1884 * ``3``: ``"linear"`` 

1885 * ``4``: ``"cubic"`` 

1886 * ``5``: ``"quintic"`` 

1887 * ``6``: ``"thin_plate"`` 

1888 

1889 *db[col+"_eps"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1890 Epsilon scaling factor for (each) RBF 

1891 *db[col+"_smooth"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1892 Smoothing factor for (each) RBF 

1893 *db[col+"_N"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1894 Number of nodes in (each) RBF 

1895 *db[col+"_xcols"]*: :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1896 List of arguments for *col* 

1897 *db.response_args[col]*: :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1898 List of arguments for *col* 

1899 :Versions: 

1900 * 2021-09-16 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1901 """ 

1902 # Create results 

1903 vals = self.genr8_rbf_cols(col, **kw) 

1904 # Check if nominal values saved 

1905 if col not in self: 

1906 # Get values from *vals* 

1907 v = vals[col] 

1908 # Save 

1909 self.save_col(col, v) 

1910 # Column index to keep *col* descriptors close 

1911 index_col = self.cols.index(col) + 1 

1912 # Suffixes to link from *vals* 

1913 for suffix in reversed(RBF_SUFFIXES): 

1914 # Special col name 

1915 colj = "%s_%s" % (col, suffix) 

1916 # Append this column 

1917 if colj not in self.cols: 

1918 self.cols.insert(index_col, colj) 

1919 # Save the values from *vals* dict 

1920 self.save_col(colj, vals[colj]) 

1921 

1922 def genr8_rbf_cols(self, col, **kw): 

1923 r"""Generate data to describe existing RBF(s) for *col* 

1924 

1925 This creates a :class:`dict` of various properties that are used 

1926 by the radial basis function (or list thereof) within *db.rbf*. 

1927 It is possible to recreate an RBF(s) with only this information, 

1928 thus avoiding the need to retrain the RBF network(s). 

1929  

1930 :Call: 

1931 >>> vals = db.genr8_rbf_cols(col, **kw) 

1932 :Inputs: 

1933 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

1934 DataKit with *db.rbf[col]* defined 

1935 *col*: :class:`str` 

1936 Name of column whose RBF will be analyzed 

1937 *expand*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

1938 Repeat properties like *eps* for each node of RBF 

1939 (for uniform data size, usually to write to CSV file) 

1940 :Outputs: 

1941 *vals*: :class:`dict`\ [:class:`np.ndarray`] 

1942 Data used in *db.rbf[col]* 

1943 *vals[col]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1944 Values of *col* used in RBF (may differ from *db[col]*) 

1945 *vals[col+"_method"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`int`] 

1946 Response method index: 

1947 

1948 * ``4``: ``"rbf"`` 

1949 * ``5``: ``"rbf-map"`` 

1950 * ``6``: ``"rbf-schedule"`` 

1951 

1952 *vals[col+"_rbf"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1953 Weight for each RBF node 

1954 *vals[col+"_func"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`int`] 

1955 RBF basis function index: 

1956 

1957 * ``0``: ``"multiquadric"`` 

1958 * ``1``: ``"inverse_multiquadric"`` 

1959 * ``2``: ``"gaussian"`` 

1960 * ``3``: ``"linear"`` 

1961 * ``4``: ``"cubic"`` 

1962 * ``5``: ``"quintic"`` 

1963 * ``6``: ``"thin_plate"`` 

1964 

1965 *vals[col+"_eps"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1966 Epsilon scaling factor for (each) RBF 

1967 *vals[col+"_smooth"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1968 Smoothing factor for (each) RBF 

1969 *vals[col+"_N"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1970 Number of nodes in (each) RBF 

1971 *vals[col+"_x0"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1972 Values of first response arg if *db.rbf[col]* is a list 

1973 *vals[col+"_X"]*: :class:`np.ndarray`\ [:class:`float`] 

1974 2D matrix of node locations for (each) RBF 

1975 *vals[col+"_x.<xcol>"]*: :class:`np.ndarray` 

1976 1D array of node location values for each response arg 

1977 *vals[col+"_xcols"]*: :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

1978 List of arguments for *col* 

1979 :Versions: 

1980 * 2021-09-15 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

1981 """ 

1982 # --- Options --- 

1983 # Expand option 

1984 expand = kw.get("expand", False) 

1985 # --- Checks --- 

1986 # Get arg list for first *coeff* 

1987 eval_args = self.get_response_args(col) 

1988 # Check for validity 

1989 if eval_args is None: 

1990 # No eval args for this coeff 

1991 raise KeyError("No 'response_args' for col '%s'" % col) 

1992 # Check if present 

1993 if col not in self: 

1994 raise KeyError("No coeff '%s' in database" % k) 

1995 # Get evaluation type 

1996 eval_meth = self.get_response_method(col) 

1997 # Check it 

1998 if eval_meth is None: 

1999 raise KeyError("No 'response_method' for col '%s'" % col) 

2000 # Check for RBFs attribute 

2001 try: 

2002 self.rbf[col] 

2003 except AttributeError: 

2004 # No definitions at all 

2005 raise AttributeError("No RBFs defined for this datakit") 

2006 except KeyError: 

2007 # No RBFs saved for ref coeff 

2008 raise KeyError("No RBFs for col '%s'" % col) 

2009 # Check if the method is in our accepted list 

2010 if eval_meth not in RBF_METHODS: 

2011 raise ValueError( 

2012 ("Response method '%s' is for col " % eval_meth) + 

2013 ("'%s' is not an RBF method" % col)) 

2014 # Number of arguments 

2015 narg = len(eval_args) 

2016 # First arg 

2017 xcol0 = eval_args[0] 

2018 # --- Init --- 

2019 # Initialize values 

2020 vals = {} 

2021 cols = [] 

2022 # Integer code for method 

2023 imeth = RESPONSE_METHODS.index(eval_meth) 

2024 # Check type 

2025 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

2026 # Get single global rbf 

2027 rbf = self.rbf[col] 

2028 rbfs = [rbf] 

2029 else: 

2030 # Get list of rbfs 

2031 rbfs = self.rbf[col] 

2032 # Number of rbfs 

2033 nrbf = len(rbfs) 

2034 # Sizes 

2035 nxs = np.array([rbfj.nodes.size for rbfj in rbfs]) 

2036 ixs = np.cumsum(nxs) 

2037 nx = np.sum(nxs) 

2038 # Special column names 

2039 col0 = col 

2040 col1 = "%s_method" % col 

2041 col2 = "%s_rbf" % col 

2042 col3 = "%s_func" % col 

2043 col4 = "%s_eps" % col 

2044 col5 = "%s_smooth" % col 

2045 col6 = "%s_N" % col 

2046 col7 = "%s_X" % col 

2047 col8 = "%s_x0" % col 

2048 col9 = "%s_xcols" % col 

2049 # Initialize values 

2050 if expand: 

2051 # Expand all cols to same size 

2052 nx2 = nx 

2053 else: 

2054 # Just repeat function index, epsilon, etc. once per RBF 

2055 nx2 = nrbf 

2056 # Initialize values in *vals* 

2057 vals[col0] = np.zeros(nx) 

2058 vals[col1] = np.zeros(nx2, dtype="int32") 

2059 vals[col2] = np.zeros(nx) 

2060 vals[col3] = np.zeros(nx2, dtype="int32") 

2061 vals[col4] = np.zeros(nx2) 

2062 vals[col5] = np.zeros(nx2) 

2063 vals[col6] = np.zeros(nx2, dtype="int64") 

2064 # Initialize arg values 

2065 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

2066 # All variables treated in like manner 

2067 vals[col7] = np.zeros((nx, narg)) 

2068 else: 

2069 # Fist *xcol* is special (fixed for each RBF) 

2070 vals[col7] = np.zeros((nx, narg-1)) 

2071 vals[col8] = np.zeros(nx2) 

2072 # --- Data --- 

2073 # Loop through RBFs 

2074 for i, rbf in enumerate(rbfs): 

2075 # Indices for this slice 

2076 ia = ixs[i] - nxs[i] 

2077 ib = ixs[i] 

2078 # Save collapsible fields 

2079 if expand: 

2080 # Save same value for every row of *col0* 

2081 ii = slice(ia, ib) 

2082 else: 

2083 # Save single value for reach RBF 

2084 ii = slice(i, i+1) 

2085 # Save main values 

2086 vals[col0][ia:ib] = rbf.di 

2087 # Save RBF weights 

2088 vals[col2][ia:ib] = rbf.nodes 

2089 # Save node locations (arg values) 

2090 vals[col7][ia:ib,:] = rbf.xi.T 

2091 # Check for map- or schedule-rbf slice col 

2092 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

2093 pass 

2094 else: 

2095 # Save the slice value 

2096 vals[col8][ii] = self.bkpts[xcol0][i] 

2097 # All x-values pa 

2098 # Save method index 

2099 vals[col1][ii] = imeth 

2100 # Save RBF basis function index 

2101 vals[col3][ii] = RBF_FUNCS.index(rbf.function) 

2102 # Save epsilon scaling factor 

2103 vals[col4][ii] = rbf.epsilon 

2104 # Save smoothing factor 

2105 vals[col5][ii] = rbf.smooth 

2106 # Save sice 

2107 vals[col6][ii] = rbf.N 

2108 # Save additional entries for each *xcol* 

2109 for j, xcol in enumerate(eval_args): 

2110 # Special column name 

2111 xcolj = "%s_x.%s" % (col, xcol) 

2112 # Check RBF type 

2113 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

2114 # Uniform behavior for all *xcols* 

2115 vals[xcolj] = vals[col7][:, j] 

2116 else: 

2117 # Handle first column separately 

2118 if j == 0: 

2119 # Link "x0" col 

2120 vals[xcolj] = vals[col8] 

2121 else: 

2122 # Save values from "nodes" 

2123 vals[xcolj] = vals[col7][:, j-1] 

2124 # Save arguments 

2125 vals[col9] = eval_args 

2126 # Output 

2127 return vals 

2128 

2129 # Convert data object to RBF 

2130 def create_rbf_from_db(self, dbf): 

2131 r"""Create RBF response from data object 

2132 

2133 :Call: 

2134 >>> db.create_rbf_from_db(dbf) 

2135 :Inputs: 

2136 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

2137 Data container with responses 

2138 *dbf*: :class:`dict` | :class:`BaseData` 

2139 Raw data container 

2140 :Versions: 

2141 * 2019-07-24 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0; :func:`ReadRBFCSV` 

2142 * 2021-06-07 ``@ddalle``: Version 2.0 

2143 * 2021-09-14 ``@ddalle``: Version 2.1; bug fix/testing 

2144 """ 

2145 # --- Checks --- 

2146 # Test that it's a **dict** 

2147 if not isinstance(dbf, dict): 

2148 raise TypeError( 

2149 "Data object is not a dict or subclass, got '%s'" % type(dbf)) 

2150 # Test for column named "eval_method" 

2151 if "eval_method" not in dbf: 

2152 raise KeyError("Data object has not column named 'eval_method'") 

2153 # Get list of columns 

2154 try: 

2155 # Use attribute from DataKit (preserves order) 

2156 cols = dbf.cols 

2157 except AttributeError: 

2158 # Copy the keys (this will not work in Python 2.x) 

2159 cols = list(dbf.keys()) 

2160 # Number of args determined by # of cols before *eval_method* 

2161 narg = cols.index("eval_method") 

2162 # Get that column 

2163 imeth = dbf["eval_method"] 

2164 # Check for valid method 

2165 if np.any(imeth != imeth[0]): 

2166 raise ValueError("Column 'eval_method' must have uniform values") 

2167 # Get first entry 

2168 imeth = int(imeth[0]) 

2169 # Check validity 

2170 if (imeth < 0) or (imeth >= len(RBF_METHODS)): 

2171 raise ValueError("Invalid 'eval_method' %s" % imeth) 

2172 # --- Args --- 

2173 # Store first columns as evaluation args 

2174 arg_cols = cols[:narg] 

2175 # Store names of output coefficients 

2176 coeff_cols = cols[narg+1::5] 

2177 # Initialize prefixed/suffixed names 

2178 args = [] 

2179 coeffs = [] 

2180 # --- Save values --- 

2181 # Loop through arg columns 

2182 for (j, col) in enumerate(arg_cols + coeff_cols): 

2183 # True column number 

2184 if j < narg: 

2185 # First *narg* columns are lookup variables 

2186 i = j 

2187 else: 

2188 # After *eval_method*, 

2189 i = narg + 1 + (j-narg)*5 

2190 # Save name 

2191 if j < narg: 

2192 # Save independent variable name 

2193 args.append(col) 

2194 else: 

2195 # Save dependent variable name 

2196 coeffs.append(col) 

2197 # Check for duplication 

2198 if col in self.cols: 

2199 raise ValueError( 

2200 "RBF output col '%s' is already present." % coeff) 

2201 # Save the data 

2202 self.save_col(col, dbf[col]) 

2203 # --- Create RBFs --- 

2204 # Dereference evaluation method list 

2205 eval_meth = RBF_METHODS[imeth] 

2206 # Get values of first arg 

2207 X0 = dbf[args[0]] 

2208 # Get number of test points 

2209 nx = X0.size 

2210 # Create matrix of input conditions 

2211 X = np.zeros((nx, narg)) 

2212 # Get slice locations if appropriate 

2213 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

2214 # Create dummy inputs for blank RBF 

2215 Z = ([0.0, 1.0],) * narg 

2216 else: 

2217 # Create dummy inputs for blank RBF 

2218 Z = ([0.0, 1.0],) * (narg - 1) 

2219 # Get unique values of first *arg* 

2220 xs = np.unique(dbf[args[0]]) 

2221 # Loop through coefficients 

2222 for j, coeff in enumerate(coeffs): 

2223 # Save evaluation arguments 

2224 self.set_response_args(coeff, args) 

2225 # Save evaluation method 

2226 self.set_response_method(coeff, eval_meth) 

2227 # Check for slices 

2228 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

2229 # %%% Global RBF %%% 

2230 # Read function type 

2231 func = RBF_FUNCS[int(dbf[col + "_func"][0])] 

2232 # Create RBF 

2233 rbf = scirbf.Rbf(*Z, function=func) 

2234 # Save not-too-important actual values 

2235 rbf.di = dbf[coeff] 

2236 # Use all conditions 

2237 rbf.xi = X.T 

2238 # Get RBF weights 

2239 rbf.nodes = dbf[coeff + "_rbf"] 

2240 # Get function type 

2241 rbf.function = func 

2242 # Get scale factor 

2243 rbf.epsilon = dbf[coeff + "_eps"][0] 

2244 # Smoothing parameter 

2245 rbf.smooth = dbf[coeff + "_smooth"][0] 

2246 # Save count 

2247 rbf.N = nx 

2248 # Save RBF 

2249 self.rbf[coeff] = rbf 

2250 else: 

2251 # Initialize RBF list 

2252 self.rbf[coeff] = [] 

2253 # Cumulative row index 

2254 i0 = 0 

2255 # Slice RBFs 

2256 for i, xi in enumerate(xs): 

2257 # Get function type 

2258 func = RBF_FUNCS[int(dbf[col + "_func"][0])] 

2259 # Initialize slice RBF 

2260 rbf = scirbf.Rbf(*Z, function=func) 

2261 # Number of points in this slice 

2262 ni = np.count_nonzero(X0 == xi) 

2263 # End of range 

2264 i1 = i0 + ni 

2265 # Use subset of conditions 

2266 rbf.xi = X[i0:i1, :].T 

2267 # Save not-too-important original values 

2268 rbf.di = dbf[coeff][i0:i1] 

2269 # Get RBF weights 

2270 rbf.nodes = dbf[coeff + "_rbf"][i0:i1] 

2271 # Get function type 

2272 rbf.function = func 

2273 # Get scale factor 

2274 rbf.epsilon = dbf[coeff + "_eps"][i0] 

2275 # Smoothing parameter 

2276 rbf.smooth = dbf[coeff + "_smooth"][i0] 

2277 # Save count 

2278 rbf.N = ni 

2279 # Save RBF 

2280 self.rbf[coeff].append(rbf) 

2281 # Update indices 

2282 i0 = i1 

2283 # Check for global RBFs or schedule 

2284 if eval_meth == "rbf": 

2285 # Break points for each independent variable 

2286 self.create_bkpts(args) 

2287 else: 

2288 # Break points for mapping variable 

2289 self.create_bkpts(args[0:1]) 

2290 # Get break points at each slice 

2291 self.create_bkpts_schedule(args[1:], args[0]) 

2292 

2293 # Read RBF directly from CSV file 

2294 def read_rbf_csv(self, fname, **kw): 

2295 r"""Read RBF directly from a CSV file 

2296  

2297 :Call: 

2298 >>> db.read_rbf_csv(fname, **kw) 

2299 :Inputs: 

2300 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

2301 Generic database 

2302 *fname*: :class:`str` 

2303 Name of CSV file to read 

2304 :See Also: 

2305 * :class:`cape.attdb.ftypes.csvfile.CSVFile` 

2306 :Versions: 

2307 * 2021-06-17 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

2308 """ 

2309 # Set warning mode 

2310 kw.setdefault("_warnmode", 0) 

2311 # Read the data 

2312 dbf = ftypes.CSVFile(fname, **kw) 

2313 # Create RBF from data 

2314 self.create_rbf_from_db(dbf) 

2315 

2316 # Write a CSV file for radial basis functions 

2317 def write_rbf_csv(self, fcsv, coeffs, **kw): 

2318 r"""Write an ASCII file of radial basis func coefficients 

2319 

2320 :Call: 

2321 >>> db.WriteRBFCSV(fcsv, coeffs=None, **kw) 

2322 :Inputs: 

2323 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

2324 Data container with responses 

2325 *fcsv*: :class:`str` 

2326 Name of ASCII data file to write 

2327 *coeffs*: :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

2328 List of output coefficients to write 

2329 *fmts*: :class:`dict` | :class:`str` 

2330 Dictionary of formats to use for each *coeff* 

2331 *comments*: {``"#"``} | :class:`str` 

2332 Comment character, used as first character of file 

2333 *delim*: {``", "``} | :class:`str` 

2334 Delimiter 

2335 *translators*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` 

2336 Dictionary of coefficient translations, e.g. 

2337 *CAF* -> *CA* 

2338 :Versions: 

2339 * 2019-07-24 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0; :func:`WriteRBFCSV` 

2340 * 2021-06-09 ``@ddalle``: Version 2.0 

2341 """ 

2342 # --- Checks --- 

2343 # Check input type 

2344 if not isinstance(coeffs, (list, tuple)): 

2345 raise TypeError("Coefficient list must be a list of strings") 

2346 elif len(coeffs) < 1: 

2347 raise ValueError("Coefficient list must have at least one entry") 

2348 # Reference coefficient 

2349 k = coeffs[0] 

2350 # Check if present 

2351 if k not in self: 

2352 raise KeyError("No coeff '%s' in database" % k) 

2353 # Get length 

2354 n = len(self[k]) 

2355 # Get arg list for first *coeff* 

2356 eval_args = self.get_response_args(k) 

2357 # Check for validity 

2358 if eval_args is None: 

2359 # No eval args for this coeff 

2360 raise KeyError("No 'response_args' for col '%s'" % k) 

2361 # Get evaluation type 

2362 eval_meth = self.get_response_method(k) 

2363 # Check it 

2364 if eval_meth is None: 

2365 raise KeyError("No 'response_method' for col '%s'" % k) 

2366 # Check for RBFs attribute 

2367 try: 

2368 self.rbf[k] 

2369 except AttributeError: 

2370 # No definitions at all 

2371 raise AttributeError("No RBFs defined for this database") 

2372 except KeyError: 

2373 # No RBFs saved for ref coeff 

2374 raise KeyError("No RBFs for coeff '%s'" % k) 

2375 # Check if the method is in our accepted list 

2376 if eval_meth not in RBF_METHODS: 

2377 raise ValueError( 

2378 "Eval method '%s' is not consistent with RBFs" % eval_meth) 

2379 # Loop through the keys 

2380 for k in coeffs[1:]: 

2381 # Check presence of required information 

2382 if k not in self.cols: 

2383 raise KeyError("No col '%s' in database" % k) 

2384 elif self.get_response_args(k) is None: 

2385 raise KeyError("No 'response_args' for col '%s'" % k) 

2386 elif self.get_response_method(k) is None: 

2387 raise KeyError("No 'response_method' for col '%s'" % k) 

2388 elif k not in self.rbf: 

2389 raise KeyError("No RBFs for coeff '%s'" % k) 

2390 # Check length 

2391 if len(self[k]) != n: 

2392 raise ValueError( 

2393 "Col '%s' has length %i; expected %i" 

2394 % (k, len(self[k]), n)) 

2395 # Check values 

2396 if self.get_response_args(k) != eval_args: 

2397 raise ValueError("Mismatching response_args for col '%s'" % k) 

2398 elif self.get_response_method(k) != eval_meth: 

2399 raise ValueError( 

2400 ("Mismatching response_method '%s' for col '%s'" % ( 

2401 self.get_response_args(k), k)) + 

2402 ("; expected '%s'" % eval_meth)) 

2403 # --- Init --- 

2404 # Number of arguments 

2405 narg = len(eval_args) 

2406 # Get method index 

2407 imeth = RBF_METHODS.index(eval_meth) 

2408 # Initialize final column list 

2409 cols = eval_args + ["eval_method"] 

2410 # Initialize values 

2411 vals = {} 

2412 # Extra columns for each output coeff 

2413 COEFF_COLS = ["", "rbf", "func", "eps", "smooth"] 

2414 # Loop through coefficients 

2415 for k in coeffs: 

2416 # Loop through suffixes to initialize columns 

2417 for suf in COEFF_COLS: 

2418 # Append suffix 

2419 col = ("%s_%s" % (k, suf)).rstrip("_") 

2420 # Add actual value at that point 

2421 cols.append(col) 

2422 # Get RBF 

2423 if imeth == 0: 

2424 # Get global rbf 

2425 rbf = self.rbf[k] 

2426 # No RBF list 

2427 nrbf = 1 

2428 # Fixed size 

2429 nx = rbf.nodes.size 

2430 else: 

2431 # Get first mapped/linear rbf slice+ 

2432 rbfs = self.rbf[k] 

2433 rbf = self.rbf[k][0] 

2434 # Number of RBF slices 

2435 nrbf = len(rbfs) 

2436 # Total number of nodes 

2437 nx = np.sum([rbfj.nodes.size for rbfj in rbfs]) 

2438 # Initialize data 

2439 vals[col] = np.zeros(nx) 

2440 # Loop through independent variables 

2441 for col in eval_args: 

2442 # Initialize the values 

2443 vals[col] = np.zeros(nx) 

2444 # Append type 

2445 for col in ["eval_method"]: 

2446 # Create values 

2447 vals[col] = np.full(nx, imeth) 

2448 # --- Data/Properties --- 

2449 # Number of columns 

2450 ncol = len(cols) 

2451 # Total number of points so fart 

2452 ny = 0 

2453 # Loop through RBF slices (same for each *coeff*) 

2454 for j in range(nrbf): 

2455 # Reference coefficient 

2456 coeff = coeffs[0] 

2457 # Get RBF handle 

2458 if imeth == 0: 

2459 # Global RBF 

2460 rbf = self.rbf[coeff] 

2461 else: 

2462 # Slice RBF 

2463 rbf = self.rbf[coeff][j] 

2464 # Number of points in slice 

2465 nj = rbf.nodes.size 

2466 # Save the argument values 

2467 for i, col in enumerate(eval_args): 

2468 if imeth == 0: 

2469 # Save all the position variables 

2470 vals[col] = rbf.xi.T[:,i] 

2471 else: 

2472 # Save the slice points 

2473 if i == 0: 

2474 # Scheduling parameter 

2475 vals[col][ny:ny+nj] = self.bkpts[eval_args[0]][j] 

2476 else: 

2477 # Secondary arg 

2478 vals[col][ny:ny+nj] = rbf.xi.T[:,i-1] 

2479 # Loop through coefficients 

2480 for i, coeff in enumerate(coeffs): 

2481 # Get the RBF 

2482 if imeth == 0: 

2483 # Global RBF 

2484 rbf = self.rbf[coeff] 

2485 else: 

2486 # Slice RBF 

2487 rbf = self.rbf[coeff][j] 

2488 # Derived columns 

2489 ccols = [ 

2490 ("%s_%s" % (coeff, suf)).rstrip("_") for suf in COEFF_COLS 

2491 ] 

2492 # Save values 

2493 vals[ccols[0]][ny:ny+nj] = rbf.di 

2494 # Save weights 

2495 vals[ccols[1]][ny:ny+nj] = rbf.nodes 

2496 # RBF type 

2497 vals[ccols[2]][ny:ny+nj] = RBF_FUNCS.index(rbf.function) 

2498 # Save spacing parameter 

2499 vals[ccols[3]][ny:ny+nj] = rbf.epsilon 

2500 # Save smoothing parameter 

2501 vals[ccols[4]][ny:ny+nj] = rbf.smooth 

2502 # Update counter 

2503 ny += nj 

2504 # Create CSV file 

2505 dbcsv = ftypes.CSVFile(vals=vals) 

2506 # Ensure proper order 

2507 dbcsv.cols = cols 

2508 # Write it 

2509 dbcsv.write_csv(fcsv, **kw) 

2510 

2511 # Determine *xcols* (including order) from existing data 

2512 def _infer_xcols(self, col, vals=None, **kw): 

2513 r"""Infer list of arguments to implied response mech for *col* 

2514 

2515 :Call: 

2516 >>> xcols = db._infer_xcols(col, vals=None, **kw) 

2517 :Inputs: 

2518 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

2519 Data interface 

2520 *col*: :class:`str` 

2521 Name of *col* whose response mechanism is queried 

2522 *vals*: {``None``} | :class:`dict` 

2523 Additional values, e.g. from :func:`genr8_rbf_cols` 

2524 *xcols*: {``None``} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

2525 Prespecified argument list 

2526 :Outputs: 

2527 *xcols*: {``None``} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

2528 Argument list for *col* implied by which cols are 

2529 present in *db* and *vals* 

2530 :Versions: 

2531 * 2021-09-16 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

2532 """ 

2533 # Default *vals* 

2534 if vals is None: 

2535 vals = {} 

2536 # Check for specified *xcols* directly in *kw* 

2537 xcols = kw.get("xcols") 

2538 # Check if valid 

2539 if xcols is not None: 

2540 return xcols 

2541 # Special column name 

2542 colx = "%s_xcols" % col 

2543 # Check for this column in several places 

2544 xcols = kw.get(colx, vals.get(colx, self.get(colx))) 

2545 # Use it if appropriate
