11922 if (dtype is not None) and not dtype.startswith("float"): 

11923 continue 

11924 # Otherwise use it 

11925 args.append(arg) 

11926 # Checks 

11927 if not isinstance(args, list): 

11928 raise TypeError("Arg list must be 'list', got %s" % type(args)) 

11929 # Number of input args 

11930 narg = len(args) 

11931 # Check types 

11932 for (j, arg) in enumerate(args): 

11933 # Check type 

11934 if not typeutils.isstr(arg): 

11935 raise TypeError( 

11936 "Arg %i must be str, got %s" % (j, type(arg))) 

11937 # Check presence 

11938 if arg not in bkpts: 

11939 raise KeyError("No break points for arg '%s'" % arg) 

11940 # --- Slice Cols --- 

11941 # Get optional slice column 

11942 scol = kw.get("scol") 

11943 # Check for list 

11944 if isinstance(scol, list): 

11945 # Get additional slice keys 

11946 subcols = scol[1:] 

11947 # Single slice key 

11948 maincol = scol[0] 

11949 elif scol is None: 

11950 # No slices at all 

11951 subcols = [] 

11952 maincol = None 

11953 else: 

11954 # No additional slice keys 

11955 subcols = [] 

11956 maincol = scol 

11957 # List of slice keys 

11958 scol = [scol] 

11959 # Remove slice keys from arg list to interpolants 

11960 if scol is None: 

11961 # No checks 

11962 iargs = args 

11963 else: 

11964 # Check against *scol* 

11965 iargs = [arg for arg in args if arg not in scol] 

11966 # Save original values for *maincol* 

11967 mainvals = self.get_values(maincol).copy() 

11968 # --- Full-Factorial Matrix --- 

11969 # Get full-factorial matrix at the current slice value 

11970 X, slices = self.get_fullfactorial(scol=scol, cols=args) 

11971 # Original values retained for creating masks during slices 

11972 X0 = {} 

11973 # Number of output points 

11974 nX = X[args[0]].size 

11975 # --- Regularization --- 

11976 # Perform interpolations 

11977 for col in cols: 

11978 # Translate column name 

11979 colreg = self._translate_colname(col, *tr_args) 

11980 # Status update 

11981 if kw.get("v"): 

11982 print(" Regularizing col '%s' -> '%s'" % (col, colreg)) 

11983 # Check for slices 

11984 if scol is None: 

11985 # One interpolant 

11986 f = self.genr8_rbf(col, args, **kw) 

11987 # Create tuple of input arguments 

11988 x = tuple(X[arg] for arg in args) 

11989 # Evaluate RBF 

11990 V = f(*x) 

11991 else: 

11992 # Number of slices 

11993 nslice = slices[maincol].size 

11994 # Initialize data 

11995 V = np.zeros_like(X[maincol]) 

11996 # Convert slices to indices within *db* 

11997 masks, _ = self.find(scol, mapped=True, mask=mask, **slices) 

11998 # Loop through slices 

11999 for i in range(nslice): 

12000 # Status update 

12001 if kw.get("v"): 

12002 # Get main key value 

12003 m = slices[maincol][i] 

12004 # Get value in fixed number of characters 

12005 sv = ("%6g" % m)[:6] 

12006 # In-place status update 

12007 sys.stdout.write(" Slice %s=%s (%i/%i)\r" 

12008 % (maincol, sv, i+1, nslice)) 

12009 sys.stdout.flush() 

12010 # Initialize mask 

12011 J = np.ones(nX, dtype="bool") 

12012 # Loop through cols that define slice 

12013 for k in scol: 

12014 # Get value 

12015 vk = slices[k][i] 

12016 # Constrain 

12017 J = np.logical_and(J, X[k]==vk) 

12018 # Get indices of slice 

12019 I = np.where(J)[0] 

12020 # Create interpolant for fixed value of *skey* 

12021 f = self.genr8_rbf(col, iargs, I=masks[i], **kw) 

12022 # Create tuple of input arguments 

12023 x = tuple(X[k][I] for k in iargs) 

12024 # Evaluate coefficient 

12025 V[I] = f(*x) 

12026 # Status update 

12027 if kw.get("v"): 

12028 # Get main key value 

12029 m = slices[maincol][i] 

12030 # Get value in fixed number of characters 

12031 sv = ("%6g" % m)[:6] 

12032 # In-place status update 

12033 sys.stdout.write("%72s\r" % "") 

12034 sys.stdout.flush() 

12035 # Save the values 

12036 self.save_col(colreg, V) 

12037 # --- New Arg Values --- 

12038 # Save the lookup values 

12039 for arg in args: 

12040 # Translate column name 

12041 argreg = self._translate_colname(arg, *tr_args) 

12042 # Save original values 

12043 #X0[arg] = self.get_all_values(arg) 

12044 # Save values 

12045 self.save_col(argreg, X[arg]) 

12046 # Check if new 

12047 if argreg != arg: 

12048 # Get previous definition 

12049 defn = self.get_defn(arg) 

12050 # Save a copy 

12051 self.defns[argreg] = self._defncls(**defn) 

12052 # Link break points 

12053 bkpts[argreg] = bkpts[arg] 

12054 # --- Co-mapped XAargs --- 

12055 # Trajectory co-keys 

12056 cocols = kw.get("cocols", list(bkpts.keys())) 

12057 # Map other breakpoint keys 

12058 for col in cocols: 

12059 # Skip if already present 

12060 if col in args: 

12061 continue 

12062 elif col in cols: 

12063 continue 

12064 # Check for slices 

12065 if maincol is None: 

12066 break 

12067 # Translate col name 

12068 colreg = self._translate_colname(col, *tr_args) 

12069 # Get values for this column 

12070 V0 = self.get_all_values(col) 

12071 # Check if present 

12072 if V0 is None: 

12073 raise KeyError("No *cocol* called '%s' found" % col) 

12074 # Check size 

12075 if mainvals.size != V0.size: 

12076 # Original sizes do not match; no map applicable 

12077 continue 

12078 # Regular matrix values of slice key 

12079 M = X[maincol] 

12080 # Initialize data 

12081 V = np.zeros_like(M) 

12082 # Initialize break points 

12083 T = [] 

12084 # Status update 

12085 if kw.get("v"): 

12086 print(" Mapping key '%s'" % col) 

12087 # Loop through slice values 

12088 for m in bkpts[maincol]: 

12089 # Find value of slice key matching that parameter 

12090 i = np.where(mainvals == m)[0][0] 

12091 # Output value 

12092 v = V0[i] 

12093 # Get the indices of break points with that value 

12094 J = np.where(M == m)[0] 

12095 # Evaluate coefficient 

12096 V[J] = v 

12097 # Save break point 

12098 T.append(v) 

12099 # Save the values 

12100 self.save_col(colreg, V) 

12101 # Save break points 

12102 bkpts[colreg] = np.array(T) 

12103 

12104 # --- Griddata --- 

12105 # Regularize using piecewise linear 

12106 def regularize_by_griddata(self, cols, args=None, **kw): 

12107 r"""Regularize col(s) to full-factorial matrix of several args 

12108 

12109 The values of each *arg* to use for the full-factorial matrix 

12110 are taken from the *db.bkpts* dictionary, usually generated by 

12111 :func:`get_bkpts`. The values in *db.bkpts*, however, can be 

12112 set manually in order to interpolate the data onto a specific 

12113 matrix of points. 

12114 

12115 :Call: 

12116 >>> db.regularize_by_griddata(cols=None, args=None, **kw) 

12117 :Inputs: 

12118 *db*: :class:`DataKit` 

12119 Database with response toolkit 

12120 *cols*: :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

12121 List of output data columns to regularize 

12122 *args*: {``None``} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

12123 List of arguments; default from *db.response_args* 

12124 *scol*: {``None``} | :class:`str` | :class:`list` 

12125 Optional name of slicing col(s) for matrix 

12126 *cocols*: {``None``} | :class:`list`\ [:class:`str`] 

12127 Other dependent input cols; default from *db.bkpts* 

12128 *method*: {``"linear"``} | ``"cubic"`` | ``"nearest"`` 

12129 Interpolation method; ``"cubic"`` only for 1D or 2D 

12130 *rescale*: ``True`` | {``False``} 

12131 Rescale input points to unit cube before interpolation 

12132 *tol*: {``1e-4``} | :class:`float` 

12133 Default tolerance to use in combination with *slices* 

12134 *tols*: {``{}``} | :class:`dict` 

12135 Dictionary of specific tolerances for single *cols* 

12136 *translators*: :class:`dict`\ [:class:`str`] 

12137 Alternate names; *col* -> *trans[col]* 

12138 *prefix*: :class:`str` | :class:`dict` 

12139 Universal prefix or *col*-specific prefixes 

12140 *suffix*: :class:`str` | :class:`dict` 

12141 Universal suffix or *col*-specific suffixes 

12142 :Versions: 

12143 * 2020-03-10 ``@ddalle``: Version 1.0 

12144 """ 

12145 # --- Options --- 

12146 # Get translators 

12147 trans = kw.get("translators", {}) 

12148 prefix = kw.get("prefix") 

12149 suffix = kw.get("suffix") 

12150 # Overall mask 

12151 mask = kw.get("mask") 

12152 # Translator args 

12153 tr_args = (trans, prefix, suffix) 

12154 # --- Status Checks --- 

12155 # Get break points 

12156 bkpts = self.__dict__.get("bkpts") 

12157 # Check 

12158 if bkpts is None: 

12159 raise AttributeError( 

12160 "Break point dict must be present; see get_bkpts()") 

12161 # --- Cols Check --- 

12162 # Convert single column 

12163 if typeutils.isstr(cols): 

12164 cols = [cols] 

12165 # Check columns 

12166 if not isinstance(cols, list): 

12167 raise TypeError( 

12168 "Regularization cols must be list, got %s" % type(cols)) 

12169 # Number of cols 

12170 ncols = len(cols) 

12171 # Check for empty list 

12172 if ncols == 0: 

12173 raise IndexError("Col list is empty") 

12174 # Check each column 

12175 for (j, col) in enumerate(cols): 

12176 # Check type 

12177 if not typeutils.isstr(col): 

12178 raise TypeError( 

12179 "Col %i must be str, got %s" % (j, type(col))) 

12180 # Check availability 

12181 if col not in self: 

12182 raise KeyError("Col '%s' is not in database" % col) 

12183 # Get data type 

12184 dtype = self.get_col_dtype(col) 

12185 # Ensure float 

12186 if not (dtype.startswith("float") or dtype.startswith("complex")): 

12187 raise TypeError( 

12188 "Nonnumeric dtype '%s' for col '%s'" % (dtype, col)) 

12189 # --- Args Check --- 

12190 # Default input args 

12191 if args is None: 

12192 # Use args for last *col* 

12193 args = self.get_response_args(col) 

12194 # Backup input args 

12195 if args is None: 

12196 # Initialize list 

12197 args = [] 

12198 # Loop through keys of *bkpts* 

12199 # Note uncontrolled order 

12200 for arg in bkpts: 

12201 # Check if used as *col* 

12202 if arg in cols: 

12203 continue 

12204 # Get data type 

12205 dtype = self.get_col_dtype(arg) 

12206 # Ensure float 

12207 if (dtype is not None) and not dtype.startswith("float"): 

12208 continue 

12209 # Otherwise use it 

12210 args.append(arg) 

12211 # Checks 

12212 if not isinstance(args, list): 

12213 raise TypeError("Arg list must be 'list', got %s" % type(args)) 

12214 # Number of input args 

12215 narg = len(args) 

12216 # Check types 

12217 for (j, arg) in enumerate(args): 

12218 # Check type 

12219 if not typeutils.isstr(arg): 

12220 raise TypeError( 

12221 "Arg %i must be str, got %s" % (j, type(arg))) 

12222 # Check presence 

12223 if arg not in bkpts: 

12224 raise KeyError("No break points for arg '%s'" % arg) 

12225 # --- Slice Cols --- 

12226 # Get optional slice column 

12227 scol = kw.get("scol") 

12228 # Check for list 

12229 if isinstance(scol, list): 

12230 # Get additional slice keys 

12231 subcols = scol[1:] 

12232 # Single slice key 

12233 maincol = scol[0] 

12234 elif scol is None: 

12235 # No slices at all 

12236 subcols = [] 

12237 maincol = None 

12238 else: 

12239 # No additional slice keys 

12240 subcols = [] 

12241 maincol = scol 

12242 # List of slice keys 

12243 scol = [scol] 

12244 # Remove slice keys from arg list to interpolants 

12245 if scol is None: 

12246 # No checks 

12247 iargs = args 

12248 else: 

12249 # Check against *scol* 

12250 iargs = [arg for arg in args if arg not in scol] 

12251 # Save original values for *maincol* 

12252 mainvals = self.get_values(maincol).copy() 

12253 # --- Full-Factorial Matrix --- 

12254 # Get full-factorial matrix at the current slice value 

12255 X, slices = self.get_fullfactorial(scol=scol, cols=args) 

12256 # Number of output points 

12257 nX = X[args[0]].size 

12258 # --- Regularization --- 

12259 # Perform interpolations 

12260 for col in cols: 

12261 # Translate column name 

12262 colreg = self._translate_colname(col, *tr_args) 

12263 # Status update 

12264 if kw.get("v"): 

12265 print(" Regularizing col '%s' -> '%s'" % (col, colreg)) 

12266 # Check for slices 

12267 if scol is None: 

12268 # Create inputs 

12269 x = tuple(X[k] for k in args) 

12270 # Single grid weights 

12271 W = self.genr8_griddata_weights(args, *x, **kw) 

12272 # Reference values 

12273 Y = self.get_values(col, mask) 

12274 # Multiply weights 

12275 V = np.dot(W, Y) 

12276 else: 

12277 # Number of slices 

12278 nslice = slices[maincol].size 

12279 # Number of output points 

12280 nout = len(X[maincol]) 

12281 # Get initial values 

12282 V0 = self.get_all_values(col) 

12283 # Extra dimensions from inputs to be copied 

12284 shape0 = V0.shape[:-1] 

12285 # Number of dimensions 

12286 ndim = V0.ndim 

12287 # Initialize data 

12288 V = np.zeros(shape0 + (nout,), dtype=V0.dtype) 

12289 # Convert slices to indices within *db* 

12290 masks, _ = self.find(scol, mapped=True, mask=mask, **slices) 

12291 # Loop through slices 

12292 for i in range(nslice): 

12293 # Status update 

12294 if kw.get("v"): 

12295 # Get main key value 

12296 m = slices[maincol][i] 

12297 # Get value in fixed number of characters 

12298 sv = ("%6g" % m)[:6] 

12299 # In-place status update 

12300 sys.stdout.write(" Slice %s=%s (%i/%i)\r" 

12301 % (maincol, sv, i+1, nslice)) 

12302 sys.stdout.flush() 

12303 # Initialize mask 

12304 J = np.ones(nX, dtype="bool") 

12305 # Loop through cols that define slice 

12306 for k in scol: 

12307 # Get value 

12308 vk = slices[k][i] 

12309 # Constrain 

12310 J = np.logical_and(J, X[k]==vk) 

12311 # Get indices of slice 

12312 I = np.where(J)[0] 

12313 # Create tuple of input arguments test values 

12314 x = tuple(X[k][I] for k in iargs) 

12315 # Create interpolant for fixed value of *scol* 

12316 W = self.genr8_griddata_weights( 

12317 iargs, *x, I=masks[i], **kw) 

12318 # Get database values 

12319 Y = self.get_values(col, masks[i]) 

12320 # Evaluate coefficient 

12321 if ndim == 1: 

12322 # Scalar 

12323 V[I] = np.dot(W, Y) 

12324 elif ndim == 2: 

12325 # Linear output 

12326 V[:,I] = np.dot(Y, W.T) 

12327 # Clean up prompt 

12328 if kw.get("v"): 

12329 sys.stdout.write("%72s\r" % "") 

12330 sys.stdout.flush() 

12331 # Save the values 

12332 self.save_col(colreg, V) 

12333 # --- Co-mapped XAargs --- 

12334 # Trajectory co-keys 

12335 cocols = kw.get("cocols", list(bkpts.keys())) 

12336 # Map other breakpoint keys 

12337 for col in cocols: 

12338 # Skip if already present 

12339 if col in args: 

12340 continue 

12341 elif col in cols: 

12342 continue 

12343 # Check for slices 

12344 if maincol is None: 

12345 break 

12346 # Translate col name 

12347 colreg = self._translate_colname(col, *tr_args) 

12348 # Get values for this column 

12349 V0 = self.get_all_values(col) 

12350 # Check size 

12351 if mainvals.size != V0.size: 

12352 # Original sizes do not match; no map applicable 

12353 continue 

12354 # Regular matrix values of slice key 

12355 M = X[maincol] 

12356 # Initialize data 

12357 V = np.zeros_like(M) 

12358 # Initialize break points 

12359 T = [] 

12360 # Status update 

12361 if kw.get("v"): 

12362 print(" Mapping key '%s'" % col) 

12363 # Loop through slice values 

12364 for m in bkpts[maincol]: 

12365 # Find value of slice key matching that parameter 

12366 i = np.where(mainvals == m)[0][0] 

12367 # Output value 

12368 v = V0[i] 

12369 # Get the indices of break points with that value 

12370 J = np.where(M == m)[0] 

12371 # Evaluate coefficient 

12372 V[J] = v 

12373 # Save break point 

12374 T.append(v) 

12375 # Save the values 

12376 self.save_col(colreg, V) 

12377 # Save break points 

12378 bkpts[colreg] = np.array(T) 

12379 # --- Regularized Arg Values --- 

12380 # Save the lookup values 

12381 for arg in args: 

12382 # Translate column name 

12383 argreg = self._translate_colname(arg, *tr_args) 

12384 # Save values 

12385 self.save_col(argreg, X[arg]) 

12386 # Check if new 

12387 if argreg != arg: 

12388 # Get previous definition 

12389 defn = self.get_defn(arg) 

12390 # Save a copy 

12391 self.defns[argreg] = self._defncls(**defn) 

12392 # Link break points 

12393 bkpts[argreg] = bkpts[arg] 

12394 # > 

12395 

12396 

12397# Combine options 

12398kwutils._combine_val(DataKit._tagmap, ftypes.BaseData._tagmap) 

« index     coverage.py v6.1.2, created at 2022-05-17 15:48 -0700
